This is his second loan which he is applying for in order to purchase a hydraulic lift and other tools such as wrenches that he needs  to equip his workshop. He lives at home with his parents and contributes toward the household expenses. 

He wants to expand his workshop as the number of customers requiring his services has gone up in recent months. He is very grateful to the agency for the support they provide.

loans.use: To purchase a hydraulic lift and tools

loans.name: Sandra Alexandre

texts.pt:
Sandra Alexandre B. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 14 e 16 anos de idade e todos vão a Escola. Fez moente 4ª classe não continuou devido problemas financeiros. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu sobrinho que vive com ele.

Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Matola quando iniciou a construção da sua casa. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 13 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 2.500.00 a 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma prima que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.

O seu maior sonho é terminar a construção da sua casa. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito.
texts.en:
Sandra Alexandre B. was born in Maputo, province of the same name, south of Mozambique, she is a single mother of 2 children 14 and 16 years old and both go to school. She studied until the 4th grade and couldn't finish due to lack of financial resources. She lives on her own house and supports also her nephew who lives with them.

She left Maputa to live in Matola when she started the construction of her house. She has her own business for the last 13 years, she doesn't have any employees, and has a profit of about 2,500 to 3,000mt a month which is used on household expenses and she is able to save some money on her bank account.

She never had loans on other banks, she learned about Hluvuku thru a cousin who was a client of the same institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku for 10,000mt and she will use it to buy construction material (cement, sand, stone, iron among others) to keep on the construction of her house.

Her largest dream is to finish the construction of her house. Sandra trusts she will pay ahead of time and be able to request another loan.

loans.use: to buy construction material (cement, sand, stone, iron among others)

loans.name: Asociaciones Unidas Group

texts.es: El entusiasmo de un grupo en su mayoría mujeres, que con esfuerzo y creatividad han sabido salir adelante para el surgimiento económico de sus negocios y sus familias. Un grupo conformado por 8 integrantes llamado Asociación Unidas, con un año de formado, en el grupo existe mucha confianza y apoyo entre todos los integrantes ya que se conoces muy bien debido a que todos son vecinos de la misma zona en la que viven. Cada integrante tiene una historia en particular pero mencionaremos solo una, la historia de Lola R. de 57 años de edad madre de tres hijos, ella se dedica diariamente a la venta de comida hace ya más de 10 años el cual le ha dado muchas satisfacciones económicas para ella y su familia y ha sido un sustento en su hogar por mucho tiempo, con el esfuerzo de la venta de  comidas a podido construir a los largo del tiempo su casa de material noble y darles una educación decente a sus hijos. Con el reciente préstamo piensa comprar mercadería para su negocio y abastecerse para los próximos meses. Como la señora Lola R. cada integrante del grupo  Asociación Unidas tiene el deseo y el empeño de seguir adelante por el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The enthusiasm and  effort and creativity of this mainly women's group has helped them get ahead with the economic impetus for their businesses and their family.  This is a group made up of 8 members called  Asociación Unidas (United Association).  The group was formed a year ago and they are very confident and supportive of each other since they are all neighbors from the same area.
  Each member has a story to tell but we will only mention one.  Lola R., 57, is the mother of three children.  She has been selling food every day for the past 10 years.  This has helped her, and her family financially, and has been a big support for them for a long time.  With the effort in the sale of the food she has been been able to build her home of good materials over a period of time, and she has given her children a decent education.  With the recent loan she plans to buy supplies for her business and stock up for the next months.  As with Mrs. Lola R. each member of the  Asociación Unidas group has the wish and goal to get ahead for the good of their families.

loans.use: With the recent loan she plans to buy supplies for her business and stock up for the next months.

loans.name: Celina Almeida

texts.pt:
Celina Almeida Babi nasceu na cidade de Maputo, província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique divorciada e mãe de 3 filhos de 5, 12 e 20 anos de idade e todos vão a Escola. Fez moente 2ª classe não continuou devido problemas financeiros. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, tem um negocio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 5 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, óleo, peixe, caldos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu produto.

 Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito, para construir a sua própria mercearia.
texts.en:
Celina Almeida Babi was born in the city of Maputo, province of the same name, south of Mozambique, she is divorced and has 3 children who are 5, 12 and 20 years old they all go to school. She studied until the 2nd grade because of lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her children and doesn't support any other relatives.

She never left the city of Maputo, she has a grocery store for the last 5 years, she doesn't has employees and is able to get a profit of 3,000mt a month which is used for household expenses and is able to save some money on her bank account.

She never had loans with other banks, and learned about Hluvuku thru a friend who is also client of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku for 10,000mt she will use it to buy supplies (rice, flour, oil, fish, soups, among others) to increase the quantity of her products.

She is confident she will pay the debt before it's due and will request another loan to build her own grocery store.

loans.use: to buy supplies (rice, flour, oil, fish, soups, among others)

loans.name: Sousa Manuel

texts.pt:
Sousa Manuel João não conseguiu comprar todo o material acordado devido a subida dos preços no mercado onde faz aquisição de matéria-prima. Mas mesmo assim comprou a maior parte do que havia planeado e deu o uso acordado com a Instituição.

Conseguiu reembolsar o valor sem problemas, o seu negocio esta muito melhor ainda com a quadra festiva que se aproxima espera haver muita procura de seus serviços. Com o presente empréstimo no valor de 15.600.00mt pretende comprar rolos de tecidos para cozer varias peças de roupa.

Houve certas mudanças na sua vida principalmente no negócio porque com os rendimentos conseguiu comprar alguns bens para a sua casa. No futuro pretende construir uma alfaiataria para tal ira a recorrer a novos empréstimos.
texts.en:
Sousa Manuel J. wasn't able to buy all the material expected because the prices in the market were he buys were too high. But he was able to buy most of what he planned and used it as agreed with the institution.

He was able to returned the loan without any problem, his business is much better now and with the holidays approaching he expects to see an increased demand of his services. With the current loan of 15,600mt he wants to buy rolls of fabric to saw several pieces of garments.

There were some changes in his life mainly in his business because with the profit he obtained, he was able to buy some items for his house. In the future he would like to build a tailor's work shop, so he would request a new loan then.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric

loans.name: Tetepelcingo Group

texts.es:
El siguiente  grupo se llama  “tetepelcingo”, se le dio este nombre porque todas  son nativas de este poblado, mismo que en mixteco, significa; “cerro de agua” (yucu nduta”). La lengua mixteca es hablada por todas las personas que  habitan en este pueblo; donde la magia de la naturaleza y el colorido tradicional de costumbres, se mezclan en un raudal de tradiciones, San Miguel Tetepelcingo, se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos al sur-oeste de Pinotepa Nacional y se caracteriza por sus telares artesanales, el numero de personas que integran el grupo es de 12, que en su mayoría son artesanas y  su representante se llama Demetria Hernández L.. 
En esta ocasión  hablaremos de la señora, Gloria Hernández Nicolás, que tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y su esposo se llama Francisco y tiene 32 años de edad quien es campesino de toda la vida y cultiva maíz, fríjol, calabazas y chile, doña Gloria es madre de 4 hijos que son: Edith de 15 años, que estudia la secundaria, Ricardo de 12, Francisco de 10 y Juan Carlos de 9 años de edad, estos tres últimos estudian la primaria.
Gloria es artesana desde los 11 años de edad, su trabajo es la elaboración  de servilletas para las tortillas, manteles, fundas para las almohadas y telares para vestir, todo esto es elaborado por una técnica muy antigua denominada telar de cintura que en mixteco se dice “sahcma-tavi” es una técnica muy original y rigurosa, ya que se cuida el origen de los hilos hasta la creación de las prendas, todo esto es un legado que data de tiempos muy remotos.
 Gloria solicitó su crédito en Fundacion Realidad para la compra de mas material para la elaboración de sus textiles, mismas que son; hilos de algodón para telar de color blanco, azul, púrpura, rojo, amarillo, verde, naranja, café, estos colores de hilos son fundamentales y característicos de sus prendas, así también ella pudo renovar algunos instrumentos de trabajo como son bastidores y rempujadotes, instrumentos que se fabrican a mano. Nos comenta que sus artesanías las elabora en su casa y después las distribuye en los alrededores de pinotepa y jamiltepec, y muchas veces es muy difícil el traslado ya que en temporadas de lluvia hay cortes de carretera o deslaves de los cerros. Nos dice que este oficio se lo enseño su madre y es el único medio por el cual las mujeres de la localidad se pueden sentir útil, todavía recuerda ese momento especial cuando creo su primer telar y ver que el producto de sus manos tienen un uso en algún hogar, en una mesa ya que las servilletas son para envolver las tortillas de maíz.
El gran sueño de Gloria es  promover sus artesanías en mercados nacionales y extranjeros ya que de esa forma se garantizaría el trabajo a todas las productoras de esta población, le gustaría crear una sociedad cooperativa donde sus productos sean apreciados por la gente también aspira a incrementar la producción de sus productos, vender mas para invertir y crecer en cuanto al numero de pedidos. Le gustaría mejorar su vivienda y ofrecerles una educación mejor a sus hijos para que ellos algún día puedan a aspirar a algo más.
La mayoría de este grupo son artesanas y son muy comprometidas con su oficio, es gente muy responsable y si de cumplir se trata ellas lo demuestran siempre, entre ellas existe la confianza necesaria y ese espíritu de ayuda mutua, son solidarias en todo y tienen muy buenas costumbres.
A nombre de todas las que conforman este grupo les agradece a fundacion y a los que colaboran en todo este proyecto que mejora vidas y que encuba los sueños de los más desprotegidos, nos dice que “la esencia del ser humano es poder ayudar a los demás.” 
Los nombres de las integrantes del grupo “Tetepelcingo” y sus actividades productivas son: 

Emilia Mariana Nicolás. – Bordadora
Reina R. López.- Bordadora
Rufina Hernández López.- Bordadora
Sofía Hernández.- Bordadora
Victoria López B..-  Bordadora
Gloria Hernández Nicolás.- Bordadora
Josefa Hernández L..- Bordadora
Demetria Hernández L..- Bordadora
Marina L. Hernández.- Venta de refrescos
Berta O. García.- Bordadora
Yolanda López L..- Bordadora
Inocencia L..- Bordadora
texts.en:
The next group is called “Tetepelcingo”, a name which was given because they are all natives of this village and which means in Mixtec “hill of water” (yucu nduta). The Mixtec language is spoken by all the people who inhabit this village where the magic of nature and their colorful traditional customs mix together in abundance. San Miguel Tetepelcingo is located 45 minutes to the southwest of the town of Pinotepa Nacional and is characterized by its handcrafted weaving. There are twelve persons who make up the group, most of them craftswomen, and their representative is Demetria Hernández L.. 

On this occasion we will speak with Gloria Hernández Nicolás. She is 31 years of age and married to Francisco, 32, a lifelong farmer who cultivates corn, beans, squash and chile. Gloria is mother to four children who are: Edith, 15, who is in middle school, and Ricardo, 12, Franciso, 10, and Juan Carlos, 9, all three of whom attend elementary school. Gloria is a craftswoman since the age of eleven. Her work is the making of tortilla cloths, tablecloths, pillow cases and handwoven clothing, all of it created using an age-old technique called “telar de cintura” [waist weaving] which is called “sahcma-tavi” in Mixtec. It is a highly original and demanding technique since the origin of the threads is maintained up through the creation of the finished article. The entire process is a legacy dating back to the very distant past. 

Gloria requested her loan with Fundación Realidad for the purchase of more material for making her textiles, as follows: cotton yarn for weaving, in white, blue, purple, red, yellow, green, orange, and brown. These colors are fundamental and characteristic of her work. She was also able to update certain tools such as frames and large pushers which are made by hand. She tells us that she does her handiwork at home and then distributes it in the areas surrounding Pinotepa and Jamiltepec. The journey is often quite difficult since during the rainy season there are road blockages or landslides. She says her mother taught her this profession and it is the only means by which the women in the area may feel useful. She still remembers that special moment when she made her first woven cloth and saw that the product of her hands has a use in the home, on a table since the napkins are for covering the corn tortillas. 

Gloria’s great dream is to promote her handicraft in national and international markets, as in this way, work would be guaranteed to all the producers in this village area. She would like to create a cooperative society in which their products are met with appreciation. She also aspires to raise production, sell more in order to invest, and increase the number of special orders. She would like to improve her living quarters and offer a better education to her children so that some day they may aspire to something more. 

Most of the group members are craftswomen and very dedicated to their profession. They are very responsible persons and when it comes to following through they always do. The women share the requisite trust and a spirit of mutual support. They help each other in everything and are very well-mannered. 

On behalf of all those who make up this group, she thanks the foundation and those who in every way contribute to this project, a project which improves lives and stokes the dreams of the most vulnerable among us. She tells us “The essence of the human being is the ability to help others”. 

The names of the Tetepelcingo group members and their businesses are:

Emilia Mariana Nicolás. – Weaver 
Reina R. López.- Weaver
Rufina Hernández López.- Weaver
Sofía Hernández.- Weaver
Victoria López B..-  Weaver
Gloria Hernández Nicolás.- Weaver
Josefa Hernández L..- Weaver
Demetria Hernández L..- Weaver
Marina L. Hernández.- Sale of drinks
Berta O. García.- Weaver
Yolanda López L..- Weaver
Inocencia L..- Weaver

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for producing handcrafted woven and embroidered items, for example, white twisted cotton yarn, skeins of yarn in red, green, blue, orange, brown and purple colors, cotton embroidery thread known as candle thread, and for the replacement of certain tools used in waist looms, that is, wooden frames and pushers

loans.name: Chicas Poderosas De Puente Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Chicas Poderosas D. Puente,  se ubica en L. comunidad D. puente D. ixtL. en el estado D. Morelos  en México. Esta comunidad se distingue por su historia, en el siglo XVI se construyó el puente que aún existe a un lado del palacio municipal y que servía para comunicar el puerto D. Acapulco y L. Ciudad D. México,  D. ahí que esta comunidad tiene el  nombre D. puente y el grupo también lo retoma para su denominación. El grupo está conformado por  11 integrantes. Cabe mencionar que recientemente se descubrió una zona arqueológica en esta misma localidad. Araceli F.  es L. tesorera del grupo, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. hilos, estambres y servilletas bordadas, negocio que inicio hace 11 años, solicita el préstamo para comprar estambres y teL. para L. elaboración D. servilletas. Araceli tiene 34 años, estudio L. licenciatura D. español, es soltera, no tiene hijos, al momento D. solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta, ya que va a poder comprar estambres que le hacían falta, quiere este crédito para tener mayor surtido D. mercancía y poder bordar mas servilletas, con las ganancias que obtenga espera ayudar a L. manutención D. sus padres ya que sólo dependen económicamente D. elL..
texts.en:
This group is called Chicas Poderosas D. Puente. The women live in the community of Puente D. IxtL. in Morelos state, Mexico. 

The community is well known because of its history. In the XVI century a bridge was built which used to link the port of Acapulco and Mexico City. It still exists today on one siD. of the Palacio Municipal. The community took its name from the bridge as did the group. 

The group has eleven members.

It should be noted that the an archeological site has recently been discovered in this area

Araceli F. is the group’s treasurer. She earns a living by selling thread, yarn, and embroidered napkins, a business she started eleven years ago. Araceli is seeking a loan to buy yarn and fabric to make the napkins. She is 34 years old, studied Spanish at university, is single and doesn’t have any children. She is happy right now as she is going to be able to buy yarn with the loan, have a greater range of stock, and be able to embroider more napkins. With the money she earns, she hopes to proviD. financial support for her parents. She is their sole means of support.

loans.use: to buy yarn and fabric for her embroidery business

loans.name: Quintin Carlos

texts.es: El cliente Quintín ya esta en la institución trece secuencias, el cliente demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos, la  actividad que tiene el cliente es el servicio de amplificación, el da servicios de amplificación  en fiestas de cumpleaños, matrimonios, kermese, quince años y conciertos de grupos, la capacidad que tiene en sus equipos es grande porque tiene unos treinta y dos amplificadores, ecualizadores y pantalla gigante para conciertos, sus contratos son frecuentemente en la zona 16 de julio y ceja de el alto, el trabajo de amplificación que tiene el cliente es duro porque tiene que trasladar su amplificadores desde su domicilio hasta el local, su propaganda la realiza en su mismo domicilio, su trabajo comienza normalmente los fines de semana desde el día jueves hasta el día domingo, su esposa se dedica a la confección de colchones y los vende en la zona 16 de julio en ahí tiene su puesto,   el tiene tres hijos  ellos están estudiando pero los fines de semana le ayudan a su padre como también a su madre, el crédito será invertido en la compra de equipos de sonido dos poderes y un ecualizador, como el  cliente ya trabajo varias secuencias con la institución,  los créditos que saco en la institución fueron invertidos en la compra de amplificadores.
texts.en: Quintín has been with our organization for thirteen loan cycles.  He has shown responsibility and punctuality in his repayments.  He works in the sound amplification industry.  He provides amplification services for birthday parties, weddings, open-air fiestas, fifteenth birthday celebrations and group concerts.  The capacity of his equipment is large because he has thirty two amplifiers, equalizers and a giant screen for concerts.  His contracts are frequently in the '16 de julio' district and Ceja de El Alto.  The amplification work which our client does is hard because he has to transport his amplifiers from his home to the places where they are required.  He creates his publicity leaflets in his own home.  He normally works weekends, from Thursday to Sunday.  His wife works making comforters which she sells in the '16 de julio' district where she has her stall.  Quintín has three children who are still in school but who help their father and mother on a weekend.  This loan will be used to purchase two-channel sound equipment and an equalizer.  Our client has already been through a number of loan cycles with our organization.  His previous loans were used to purchase amplifiers.

loans.use: To buy two-channel sound equipment and an equalizer

loans.name: Raquel Francico

texts.pt:
Raquel Francisco Macave M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique solteira e mãe de 2 filhas de 18 e 20 anos de idade e todos vão a Escola. Fez 6ª classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e sustenta a mãe e sobrinha que vivem com ela.

Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, tem um negocio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 4 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum através de xitique diário (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, óleo, peixe, caldos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu produto.

 Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito, para construir uma banca no quintal da sua casa.
texts.en:
Raquel Francisco Macave M. was born in the city of Maputo, province of the same name, south of Mozambique, she is a single mother with 2 daughters who are 18 and 20 years old and they go to school. Raquel studied until the 6th grade because of lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her children and supports her mom and a nice who live with her.

She never left the city of Maputo, she has a grocery store for the last 4 years, she doesn't have any employees and is able to profit close to 3,000mt a month which she applies to household expenses and is able to save some money thru a traditional saving system.

She never had a loan with other banks, and learned about Hluvuku thru a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku for 8,000mt which she expects to use to buy products (rice, flour, oil, fish, soups, among others) to increase the quantity of her products.

She is confident she will pay on time and will request another loan to build a store in a section of her house.

loans.use: to buy products (rice, flour, oil, fish, soups, among others)

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 41 años, es una madre de familia muy noble y amigable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus hijos. El negocio al que se dedica Sonia, es la venta de gaseosas y cervezas, actividad que lo realiza junto al taller de mecánica donde trabaja su esposo. Es así que se levanta temprano, para tener listo el almuerzo, que luego es llevado a su negocio, en donde ofrece estos platillos mediante previo pedido. Es esta su rutina y le va muy bien por lo que se siente muy contenta realizando su actividad. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es llevar su cuenta en orden, anotando las ventas y compras de cada día. Es por eso que esta segura de la rentabilidad de este negocio, y espera con el tiempo instalar su negocio en su casa, de ese modo estar pendiente de sus hijos. Es su 16avo crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas como lo venia haciendo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y pendiente de las reuniones que realizan. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más cajas de cervezas y gaseosas para tener su negocio mas abastecido de este producto.
texts.en:
41-year old Sonia is a fine friendly woman who lives in her own house with her husband and children. She earns her living by selling soft drinks and beer near the workshop where her husband works. 

Sonia gets up early to prepare food which she then takes with her to her place of work. She sells these previously-ordered meals. It’s a job that is going well and she feels happy doing it. Sonia most enjoys keeping the accounts in order, noting sales and purchases each day. This way she knows if the business is turning a profit. One day she hopes to run the business from her home so she can spend more time with her children.

This is Sonia’s 16th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make the repayments punctually as she always has done in the past. In her community bank she is a very active member and participates in the meetings. With the loan she will buy more cases of beer and soft drinks so her business is better stocked.

loans.use: to buy more cases of beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Pensamientos Group

texts.es:
Pensamientos es un grupo conformado por 13 mujeres quienes aparte de ser amas de casa son mujeres trabajadoras para salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Sus reuniones son muy divertidas ya que siempre se la pasan riendo y son muy unidas. La comunidad en donde viven se llama Santa C., Valle de Chalco, Estado de México. 

María de Lourdes O. S. de 39 años de edad es madre de tres hijas y uno más que viene en camino motivo por el cual está muy contenta ya que nacerá aproximadamente el 24 de Diciembre y será su regalo de navidad. Ella se dedica a la venta de postres como: gelatinas, flanes, etc., desde hace dos años ya que es una persona a la cual le gusta ganarse su propio dinero y poder ayudar en su hogar. El trato que le ofrece a la gente es muy amable y respetuoso, sus ventas son diario y sale desde muy temprano ya que es cuando hay más ventas, ofrece con los vecinos y en ocasiones a la escuela donde asisten sus hijas. Durante su tiempo libre también se dedica al bordado de servilletas, manteles ya que hay gente que le hace pedidos para fechas especiales como día de las madres, navidad, cumpleaños, etc.,  Con el crédito solicitado va a comprar: grenetina, leche, moldes, cucharas, etc., para poder surtir un pedido que tiene para el siguiente mes. Mari agradece el apoyo que recibe ya que si les es de gran ayuda. Sus planes son poder iniciar una nueva actividad como venta de ropa para el próximo año.

Las demás integrantes de Pensamientos son: 
María Elena Dámaso Jiménez (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo), 
María del Socorro R. S. (Refaccionaria), 
Raquel O. S. (Estética)
Reyna S. C. (Industria Bordadora), 
Norma Zenón M. (Venta de Frutas y Legumbres), 
María del Roció C. M. (Venta de Frutas y Legumbres)
Maricela C. Ramírez (Venta de Música), 
Concepción González C. (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo)
Paulina Ramírez González (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo), 
Rose lía García Cuandòn (Venta de Videojuegos),
María Esther Pérez H. (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo),
Sara Zenón M. (Venta de Ropa Interior por Catalogo)
texts.en:
“Thoughts” is a group made up of 13 women that, in addition to being housewives, are workingwomen that want to progress and help their families. Their meetings are very entertaining. They laugh a lot and are a very cohesive group. They live in a community called Santa C. in the Chalco Valley in the state of Mexico.
Maria is 39 years old. She is the mother of three daughters and has one on the way that will be born around the 24th of December and will be her Christmas present. For the past two years she has been selling deserts such as jellies and flans. She is a person that likes to earn her own money in order to help with the home. She is very respectful and friendly to her customers. She sells her products daily in the mornings, as that is when there are the most sales. She sells to her neighbors and sometimes at her children’s school. In her free time she embroiders napkins and tablecloths. There are people who request these items for special occasions such as Mother’s Day, Christmas, Birthdays, etc. With the loan that she is requesting she will buy gelatin, molds, spoons, etc. in order to prepare an order she has received for the coming month. Mari is appreciative of the support that she receives. It is a great help. Her plan is to start a new business, selling clothes, next year.
The other members of the group called “Thoughts” are Maria Elena (sells cosmetics from catalogues), Maria Socorro (repair shop), Raquel O. (cosmetician), Reyna (embroidery industry), Norma (sells fruits and vegetables), Marcela (sells music), Concepción (sells shoes from a catalogue), Rose (sells videogames), and Sara (sells underwear from a catalogue).

loans.use: They will buy cosmetics, perfumes, shoes, thread, napkins, earrings, etc.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha forma parte del banco comunal “Esperanza y Fe” de la comuna de Independencia.  Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa de temporada y por encargos. Por ejemplo, para las fiestas patrias de nuestro país (en el mes de septiembre) hace los trajes típicos. También hace vestidos de graduación, ropa de casa (sábanas, cortinas) y ahora está trabajando en poleras para un colegio. Martha trabaja en esto hace 3 años aproximadamente. Antes tenía una verdulería,  pero cuando nació su hija, quien ahora tiene 2 años y medio, dejó ese negocio. 
Con este préstamo comprará telas para hacer manteles con diseños navideños y poleras y  dejará una parte del dinero para mandar a bordar algunas prendas. De hecho, ha detectado la necesidad de bordado para sus prendas, por lo que su meta más cercana es comprar una máquina bordadora. 
Su sueño es tener un taller de confección, en donde pueda dar trabajo a otras personas y tener su casa propia, para lo cual le falta solo un poco de dinero. 
A Martha le ha sido un gran apoyo Fondo Esperanza, para emprender en su negocio. También agradece la facilidad con la que le entregan los préstamos.
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Se caracteriza por la presencia de edificios de mediana altura. Aquí se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile, entre otros 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the “Esperanza y Fe” (Hope and Faith) communal bank in Independencia.  She manufactures seasonal and made-to-order clothing.  For example, for the country’s national feast days (in the month of September) she makes traditional costumes.  She also makes graduation dresses, household items (sheets, drapes) and now she is making t-shirts for a high school.  She has been in this line of work for about 3 years.  She used to be a vegetable merchant but when her daughter, who is now 2 years old, was born she left that business.

She will use this loan to buy fabric to make tablecloths with Christmas designs and t-shirts.  Some of the money will be used to pay to have some embroidery done on some of the items.  As a matter of fact, she has noticed the need to embroider her items so her short-term goal is to buy an embroidering machine. Her dream is to have a sewing workshop where she can employ others and to have her own home for which she still lacks a little money.

Support from Fondo Esperanza has been a great support for Martha’s business.  She is also thankful for the ease with which loans are delivered.

Independencia is one of the 34 communes that make up the city of Santiago (capital of Chile) and is located in the center-north sector.  It’s noted for its medium size buildings.  The Chilean Indigenous Cultural Center, as well as six other Chilean historical monuments, is located here.

loans.use: For fabric.

loans.name: Mercedes Bolivia

texts.es:
Mercedes de 44 años, trabaja vendiendo comida en un colegio, vive con su esposo e hijo en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso. 

Trabaja en un colegio vendiendo comida desde ya mucho tiempo para ayudar con los gastos de su familia a su esposo. Aunque desea tener su propio comedor sigue trabajando porque aun no tiene el dinero necesario para ello. Una de las dificultades de su trabajo es la distancia que tiene el colegio a su casa ya que tiene que ir en los buses urbanos.    

Su casa es de ladrillos y desea construirla mejor para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques y pintura. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener un local de venta de comidas.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 44 years old and she sells food in a school; she lives with her husband and son in a zone called Paraiso located in the outskirts of the city.

She has been selling food in a school for a long time to help her husband with the family expenses. Although she wishes to have her own eatery, she continues to work because she does not have the necessary money. A difficulty with her job is the distance from her house to the school, since she has to use public transportation.

She has a brick house and she wishes for building improvements so she can offer a better life to her son; with the loan, she wants to buy cement, bricks, and paint. In the future, she wants to finish building her house and have an establishment to sell food.

loans.use: Cement, bricks, paint

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: El Roble Group

texts.es:
La señora Segunda Ramírez Hernández, vive en la localidad de Ocotepec Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Facundo C. Chavaría, en su poder tiene una hija de doce años y se llama Brenda Guadalupe que está en sexto de primaria.
             Ella solicito el préstamo junto con dos compañeras mas para invertirlo en la tortillería, ya que para tenerlo en  buenas condiciones se nenecita suficiente dinero  y ella sola no puede con los gasto, fue así como se asocio con doña Marcelina y las señora María Luz y  juntas aporten y mantenga su negocio.
            Lo que motivo a la señora en poner una tortillería fueron  sus hijos ya que en la localidad donde ellos viven no hay tortillería y tienen  que hacerlo a mano, y ya se les hace muy pesado  a la personas,  y aun que es la primera vez que se anima a tenerla espera que con la ayuda de Dios  y  del préstamo le irá bien.
            Lo que ella desea es que su negocio de la tortillería crezca día con día y así tenga como apoyarse durante dios le preste vida, como tambien apoyar a su hija que está estudiando y a que para ella es muy importante a que termine una carrera.
         Segunda formo el grupo junto con dos  vecinas que viven en la misma localidad y lleva por nombre el roble la razón del nombre es porque en donde ellas viven ay un arbolito de roble.
      Las personas que integran el grupo son tres y son las siguientes:
       Marcelina Altuna Sánchez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de maseca, gas, y también darle mantenimiento a la maquina para hacer tortilla.
       Segunda Ramírez Hernández: invertirá el préstamo para comprar herramientas para la maquina de elaborar tortillas.
        Maria  luz C. M.: comprar gas y herramientas para elaborar tortillas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Segunda R. Hernandez lives in the town of Ocotepec, state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Mr. Facundo C. Chavarria and she is responsible for her 12-year daughter whose name is Brenda Guadalupe and she is in sixth grade.

She is requesting a loan with two additional friends to invest it a shop to sell tortillas; adequate money is needed to maintain the shop in good condition and she cannot support the expense alone; for that reason, she became partners with Mrs. Marcelina and Mrs. Maria Luz to contribute and maintain the business together. 

What motivated her to setup the tortilla shop were her children; there are no tortilla shops in their area and people need to make tortillas by hand, which is a lot of work; even though it is the first time she finds the courage to setup the shop, she hopes for the best with the help of God and the loan.

She wishes for her tortilla business to grow day after day, and have the means to support herself while God grants her life, and also support her daughter who is studying. It is very important for Mrs. Segunda that her daughter finishes her education.

Mrs. Segunda formed the group with two neighbors who live in the same neighborhood; the group is called El Roble (The Oak); the reason for the name is because there is small oak tree where they live.

The following three people form the group: Marcelina Altuna S. will in invest the loan in buying maseca (corn flour), propane and providing maintenance to the tortilla maker; Segunda R. Hernandez will invest the loan in buying tools for the tortilla maker; Maria Luz C. Munoz will buy propane and tools to make tortillas.

loans.use: Buy propane, maseca (corn flour) and tools for the tortilla shop.

loans.name: Xochicalco Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Xochicalco, se ubica en el estado de Morelos en México, esta comunidad se distingue por el  importante sitio arqueológico Xochicalco, que significa el lugar de la casa de las flores, este lugar fue fundado en los años 650-900. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes.La Sra. Mercedes S., es integrante del grupo, se dedica a la venta de comida,  negocio que inicio hace tres años, solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos. Mercedes tiene 30 años, estudio hasta el 6o año de primaria, es casada tiene un total de 3 hijos todos varones de 10,8 y 6 años de edad respectivamente. Su puesto es ambulante, es decir vende la comida fuera de su casa, y en la escuela de la comunidad. Al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque es la primera vez que se le otorgará un crédito, quiere este crédito para comprar insumos no perecederos  como aceite y arroz que utiliza para la elaboración de su comida, también espera que con las ganancias pueda comprar una mesita o pintura para la fachada de su casa.
texts.en:
This group is called “Xochicalco” and located in the State of Morelos in Mexico. The community is known for the important archaeological site of Xochicalco, which means “the place of the house of flowers”. This place was founded between the years of 650-900.

This group consists of nine members. Sra. Mercedes S. is a member of the group. She sells food and started her business three years ago. Mercedes is married and has three children, all sons who are 10, 8, and 6 respectively. She sells food from a mobile stand that she parks outside of her house and at the community school. Upon submitting her loan request, Mercedes felt happy because this is the first time she is being given credit. She wants to use this loan to buy nonperishable supplies such as oil and rice for preparing her dishes. In addition, she hopes to use her earnings to buy a small table and paint for the façade of her house.

loans.use: Purchase oil & rice

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: La Sra. Jaqueline es una cliente antigua de la institución, la señora vive  en la casa de su papá, ella se dedica a la venta de condimentos en cajas como ser comino ajo, pimienta, ají con picante y otros los cuales los elabora en su casa para repartir los días sábado en la graneros y  mercados, también los días miércoles viaja a Oruro donde reparte por mayor la mercadería. Doña Jaqueline vive sola ya que su pareja le abandono hace mas de cinco años y ella trabaja para sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo el cual tiene 6 años de edad la señora saca el préstamo para la compra de material para envasar los condimentos.
texts.en:
Sra. Jaqueline is a longtime client of Emprender. She lives at her father’s house and sells packages of condiments such as cumin, garlic, pepper, chili powder, and other spices that she makes at home. Jaqueline delivers her products on Saturdays to granaries and markets. On Wednesdays, she travels to Oruro to sell her merchandise in bulk.

Doña Jacqueline lives alone because her husband abandoned her more than five years ago. She works so that her six year old son can get ahead. Jaqueline is taking out a loan so that she can buy materials for packaging her condiments.

loans.use: Purchase materials for packaging condiments

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 36 años, casada y madre de tres hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Tras el viaje de su tía al extranjero, se le abrió las puertas al negocio. Desde entonces se dedica a la venta de aretes y collares artesanales. Por ello espera cada fin de mes, para recibir el pedido de sus clientes, hasta alcanzar el kilo exacto en aretes y collares de fantasía para que le puedan hacer llegar tal requerimiento. Es así que viene trabajando hace dos años en esta actividad, siendo su trabajo la recolección de pedidos de estas joyas artesanales, por lo que lo considera tranquilo y rentable su trabajo. En adelante, piensa poner su tienda de joyas, para abarcar otros mercados, además de las artesanías.Es su 16avo crédito con MFP y se compromete a seguir pagando como hasta ahora de manera puntual. En su banco comunal es un clienta muy activa y comprometida con las reuniones. Con el crédito que solicita, va comprar fantasía de alpaca que son utilizadas para la elaboración de aretes, collares y pulseras, y poder enviar el pedido pendiente que tiene.
texts.en:
Maritza is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She and her family live in their own home. After her aunt took a trip abroad, Maritza opened the doors of her business. Since then, she has sold handcrafted earrings and necklaces. At the end of each month, she waits to receive orders from her customers so that she will know to the exact kilo how much wool she needs to buy to make the earrings and necklaces. Maritza has been working in this business for two years. She chose to make jewelry as her line of work because she considers it to be peaceful and profitable. In the future, she plans to open a jewelry store and sell at the other markets and craft fairs.

This is her sixteenth loan with MFP. Maritza promises to continue submitting her payments in a prompt manner. She is one of most active and committed members at her Communal Bank meetings. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy the “Fantasia” brand of alpaca wool for making earrings, necklaces, and bracelets so that she can complete her outstanding orders.

loans.use: Purchase alpaca wool & metal used in producing her handmade jewelry

loans.name: Las Amigas Vecinas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Las Amigas Vecinas, se encuentra  ubicado en el Estado D. Puebla en México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes.Margarita Martínez  es  integrante D. este grupo. Tiene 50 años, estudio hasta el 6º año D. primaria, es casada tiene un  total D. 5 hijos; 4 mujeres y 1 varón. Ella se dedica a la venta D. antojitos mexicanos que inicio hace 15 años. Solicita el  préstamo para la compra D. insumos y mobiliario como  son mesas y sillas para su negocio, sus clientes dicen que son L. mejores antojitos D. la región, además D. que la prefieren por que  otorga un buen servicio. Al momento D. solicitar el préstamo se siente muy contenta y quiere este préstamo hacer mejoras en su establecimiento D. venta.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Amigas Vecinas” (The Neighboring Friends), which can be found in the State of Puebla in Mexico. The group consists of nine members.

Margarita Martínez is one of the members. She is 50 years old and has a sixth graD. education. Margarita is married and has five children, four daughters and a son. She has a business selling Mexican snacks that she started 15 years ago. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies and furniture, such as tables and chairs, for her business. Her customers say she makes the best snacks in the region and that they choose her business because she provides good service. Upon receiving her loan, Margarita was pleased and wanted to use the loan to make improvements to her establishment.

loans.use: Purchase supplies & furniture for a Mexican snack business

loans.name: Celibataire Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité CÉLIBATAIRE est créé le 28 mars 2008. Il est composé de 08 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc villageois de MONTAGNE NORD2

Madame Boye Guèye N. debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge.

Elle fait du commerce de thioub. Elle s'approvisionne auprès de ses amies qui achète la marchandise dans les pays limitrophes et revend dans les marchés de sa localité.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'augmenter ses provisions afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices

Son objectif est d'augmenter ses épargnes et prendre en charge les études de ses enfants
texts.en:
The “Celibataire” solidarity group has been created on March 28, 2008. It is composed of eight women living in the same neighborhood. They are neighbors and friends who decided to form a group together. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Montagne Nord2. 

Mrs. Boye Guèye N., standing to the right in the photo is the group’s leader. She is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of four dependent children. She sells “thioub,” a traditional tinted fabric. She buys her wares from friends who bring merchandise from the neighboring countries and resells at the local markets. Her new loan will allow her to expand her stock so as to increase her revenues. 

Her goal is to grow her savings and to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: Strengthening her business

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.es:
Doña Altagracia, resiD. en el Cantón Pedernal, del municipio D. Chilanga, posee un comedor, tiene 47 años D. edad y vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos, Digna es la mayor D. 23 años D. edad y es la que le ayuda en el negocio y su otro hijo René que actualmente estudia 7° grado en la escuela; la fuente D. ingreso D. esta familia es el comedor.
La señora Altagracia tiene más D. 10 años D. trabajar con comida y tiene su comedorcito en el mercado municipal D. San Francisco Gotera,  atendiéndolo desD. muy temprano hasta horas D. la tarD., las dificultades D. ella es que en ocasiones se queda sin dinero para comprar alimentos para preparar las comidas, este motivo le lleva a solicitar un préstamo y contar D. esta manera con una fuente que le permita comprar D. aquellos productos que pueden durar más en la cocina y los que le son mayormente demandados.
La señora sueña con sacar adelante a sus hijos dándoles los estudios  necesarios para la superación D. estos y así mismo quiere atender las demandas D. su hogar mejorando su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Doña Altagracia resides in Pedernal Canton, which is part of the township of Chilanga. She owns a diner. Altagracia is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children. Digna, her older child, is 23 years old and helps with the business. Her other child, René, is currently a seventh graD. student. The diner serves as a source of income for her family.

Sra. Altagracia has been preparing food for more than ten years and set up her small diner at the municipal market of San Francisco Gotera. She manages it from the early morning hours until the afternoon. On occasion she has run out of money needed to buy food for preparing her dishes. This motivated her to apply for a loan so that she could have the means to buy products that would make her kitchen inventory last longer and are in great demand.

Sra. Altagracia dreams of moving her children forward by providing the necessary education to help them succeed. She also wants to meet the demands of her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more sweets & sodas to restock her business

loans.name: Concepcion Magdalena

texts.es:
Doña Concepción, tiene 50 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, vive con su madre y también tiene un hijo pero ya no vive con doña concepción, el negocio lo poseía primeramente su madre y el cual aprendió a administrarlo muy bien.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería ya que quiere tener a disposición D. los clientes variedad D. prendas D. vestir, en colores  y modas diferentes para que puedan estar satisfechos y contar con su preferencia, este préstamo le ayudara a retener la clientela y a mejorar los ingresos D. su hogar pues espera aumentar las ventas al realizar esta inversión. 
El sueño D. doña Concepción es tener un negocio granD., sin mayores dificultades para atender la demanda y también quiere proveer a su familia los ingresos para solventar las necesidades mas urgentes.
texts.en:
Doña Concepción is 50 years old and lives with her mother in the Department of Usulután. She also has a son, but he does not live with her. Her business is primarily owned by her mother, but she has learned to manage it very well.

Concepción is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to offer to her customers. She hopes to proviD. them with a variety of clothing in different colors and styles in order to satisfy their preferences. This loan will help her retain customers and improve her household income. She expects to increase her sales as a result of this investment.

Doña Concepción dreams of having a large business without the major challenge of keeping up with demand. She also wants to proviD. her family with the income to meet the most urgent necessities.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: San Cristobal Group

texts.es: El grupo San Cristóbal recibe este nombre ya que se ubica en la comunidad de San Cristóbal Tepatlaxco perteneciente al Estado de Puebla México. El grupo quiso ponerle el nombre de su comunidad ya que se sienten orgullosas de haber nacido en esta tierra en la que han vivido toda su vida.La señora Isabel C. tiene 42 años y es casada. Se dedica a vender ropa a personas de su misma comunidad quienes la conocen como una persona amable y que ha trabajado duramente para sacar a su familia adelante. Requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa de temporada ya que tiene muchos pedidos de ropa de invierno, dado que sus clientes siempre le hacen pedidos anticipados en esta temporada. En el momento de recibir el préstamo se siente orgullosa de ella misma porque tiene la oportunidad de seguir contribuyendo a mejorar el bienestar de su familia, además de que se siente realizada personalmente.
texts.en:
The San Cristóbal Group received this named because it is located in the community of San Cristóbal Tepatlaxco, which is part of the State of Puebla in Mexico. The group members wanted to be named after their community because they are proud of their birthplace and have lived there their entire lives.

Sra. Isabel C. is 42 years old and married. She sells clothing to people in her community who know her to be a friendly person and a hard worker who tries to move her family forward. Isabel needs a loan to buy seasonal clothing since she has several orders for winter garments. Her customers always place their orders before the season begins. Upon receiving her loan, Isabel felt proud of herself because she has the opportunity to continue improving the welfare of her family. This moment also provides her personal fulfillment.

loans.use: Purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
El Señor Nicolás V. Cáceres es soltero y no tiene hijos, desde muy pequeño el trabajo para subsistir ya que sus padres fallecieron cuando él era muy joven, su hermano mayor fue padre y madre para él, hace como unos 6 años que el se independizo vive solo y trabaja para tener un futuro muy prospero, él trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato “CARRASCO” en la localidad de Puerto Ivirgarzama, en el cual esta hace mas de 4 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y mejorar el servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.

 Cabe señalar que el señor Nicolás V. Cáceres se apersono a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución
texts.en:
Sr. Nicolás V. Cáceres is single and does not have children. From an early age, he had to work to support himself since his parents died when he was a very young. His older brother served as both father and mother to him. Six years ago he began living on his own and working to have a more prosperous future. Nicolás works as a motorcycle taxi driver for the Carrasco union in the town of Puerto Ivirgarzama. He has been an active member for more than four years. The service he provides is profitable since many people request this form of transportation because of its ease, speed, and efficiency. The union has designated stops and routes for each of its members in different parts of Ivirgarzama where people request transportation services.

This is the first loan Nicolás has obtained from CIDRE and he will use the funds to purchase a new motorcycle. He has already completed a work cycle and can now improve service to his customers. This will allow him to earn more income and improve his quality of life.

It should be noted that Sr. Nicolas C. V. showed up to apply for a loan after his co-workers informed him about the good credit terms that CIDRE offers.

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora de 45 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 12 años, se dedica a la venta de bisutería, así como en la confección  y venta de rosarios y denarios para las iglesias y demás tiendas comerciales del mercado central. En sus inicios, tejía cadenas, armaba collar de perlas en fantaseo y dijes de rosarios, pues le resultaba muy tedioso y a veces no se abastecía, con los pedidos que le pedían. Desde entonces manda a tejer las cadenas y perlas a sus vecinas y amigas y desde entonces le va muy bien; ahora cumple con todos los pedidos que le solicitan. Es por ello que se siente muy feliz  con el trabajo que realiza y para mejorar la modalidad de sus ventas, todos los modelos los plasmó en un catálogo, desde ahí ofrece los modelos de rosarios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que le es muy rentable, permitiéndole pagar a sus 4 tejedoras y para el futuro, planea ampliar su mercado, de esa manera poder ganar más y terminar de construir su casa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará cruces y alambres por kilos, de ese modo pueda abastecer todos los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Martha, age 45, is a hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children. For the past twelve years, she has been selling trinkets. She also makes and sells rosaries and crucifix charms to sell to churches and at commercial stores in the central market. In the beginning Martha produced her own woven chains, pearl necklaces, and rosary charms. However, the work was tedious and she sometimes did not have enough supplies to complete her orders. Then she contracted the work of producing chains and pearl necklaces to her friends and neighbors and has done very well since then. Now she is able to complete all of the orders that are submitted to her. For this reason, Martha is very pleased with the work she has accomplished and wants to improve her sales methods. All of her products are contained in a catalog from which she offers every type of rosary. What she enjoys most about her job is that it is profitable and allows her to pay her four workers. In the future, Martha has plans to expand her market so that she can earn more and finish the construction of her house.

This is her first loan with MFP. Martha knows that this loan will be beneficial to increase her operating capital, so she promises to submit all of her payments on time. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy crucifixes and craft wire by the kilo so that she can complete all of her orders.

loans.use: Purchase crucifixes and craft wire for making rosaries

loans.name: Zoila Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Guerra De Los Sexos   se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

La señora Zoila ya lleva en el Banco Comunal tres años, nos cuenta que le gusta el Banco por las facilidades que brinda la institución para obtener los créditos. Tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 5 hijas, ya todas mayores de edad, pero dos de ellas viven aun con ella. Su marido es chofer. En su juventud estudio corte y confección en la sociedad de modistas de Portoviejo.

Tiene un pequeño taller en su casa donde cose todo tipo de ropa, hace de todo menos pantalones para hombre y lo que más le gusta es hacer ropa de niñas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 20h00 y en días que tiene mucho trabajo hasta la madrugada por que para ella es muy importante la puntualidad para entregar sus obras, una de sus hijas le ayuda cuando tiene mucho que hacer.

Este crédito es para comprar telas y materiales para la elaboración de las obras. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y contratar operarias para generar trabajo y producir más.
texts.en:
The community bank La Guerra De Los Sexos (War of the Sexes) meets every 15 days in the parish Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a place known as being very commercial, for its traditional celebrations of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the rich cultural history that surrounds its mountains.
Señora Zoila has been in the community bank for three years.  She tells us that she likes the ban for the facilities that it supplies the group in order to obtain loans.  She is 54 years old, she is married and from his relationship she has had 5 daughters, now all of age.  Two of them still live with her.  Her husband is a driver.  In her youth, she briefly studied and worked in the milliner's society of Portoviejo.

She has a small workshop in her house where she sews all types of clothing.  She makes everything except men's pants, and she likes making girl's clothing best.  She works every day from 8am until 8pm, and on days when she has a lot of work, she works until dawn because it is very important to her to be punctual in delivering her work.  One of her daughters helps her when she has a great deal to do.

This loan is to purchase fabric and materials for the production of her work.  Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and to find contract orders in order to generate work and produce more.

loans.use: Comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres, etc.To buy fabric, buttons, fasteners, etc. for Zoila's business

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel tiene la  edad de 26 años vive en la Localidad  de el  Torno,  Barrio Naciones Unidas vive en la zona hace 20 años el señor oriundo de  Santa Cruz Andrés Ibáñez. Su Actividad es la venta de medicina natural hace 12 años actualmente trabaja en el Torno, su estado civil soltero  cuentan actualmente con 1 hijo a su cargo,  el señor vive en la casa de su madre la Sra. Zenobia   que también se dedica a al venta  de medicina natural, el Sr. miguel solicito el crédito para aumentar capital de trabajo en compra de frascos y sobres para etiquetar y llenar el producto.  Al mismo tiempo ellos están agradecidos con nuestra entidad por apoyarlos y depositarles la confianza para adquirir su crédito.
texts.en:
Miguel, 26, has lived in El Torno’s Naciones Unidas neighborhood for 20 years.  He is from Andrés Ibáñez province, Santa Cruz department.

He has sold natural remedies for 12 years; he currently works in El Torno.  He is single and has a son in his care.  He lives in his mother, Zenobia’s, house who also sells natural remedies.

Miguel requested the loan to increase his working capital to buy jars and envelopes to label and fill with product.

They are grateful with our entity for supporting them and trusting them enough to grant the loan.

loans.use: To buy jars and envelopes.

loans.name: María Mariuxi

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Guerra De Los Sexos  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

Aquí encontramos a María, tiene 20 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus dos hermanos menores que estudian en colegio.

Se dedica al comercio vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja cuatro días en la semana desde las 8 am hasta las 14h00, recorre la ciudad para vender su mercadería, deja a crédito y cobra por semana o por quincena de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Cada quince o al fin de mes se va  Guayaquil a comprar su mercadería.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil a comprar sus productos en especial interiores y blusas de damas. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado a través de los créditos. Sus sueños tener un local propio y seguir ayudando a sus padres y hermanos.
texts.en:
The community bank La Guerra De Los Sexos (War of the Sexes) meets every 15 days in the parish Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a place known as being very commercial, for its traditional celebrations of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the rich cultural history that surrounds its mountains.
Here we find 20 year old María.  She is single and she lives in her parent's house with her two younger siblings who are studying in high school.

She works in the commercial district selling clothing of all types.  Her manner of selling is to go door to door, working four days in the week from 8am until 2pm, criss-crossing the city to sell her merchandise, sold on credit and collected weekly or every 15 days according to the preference of her clients.  Every 15 days, or at the end of the month, she goes to Guayaquil to purchase her merchandise.

This loan is to go to Guayaquil to purchase her products, especially underwear and women's blouses.  This is her third loan cycle with the community bank and she llives it for the help that they have given her with her loans.  Her dreams and to have her own business location and to continue helping her parents and siblings.

loans.use: To buy clothing for María's business

loans.name: Rosa Adela

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer activa al comercio, desde hace varios años comercializa ropa de dama, niñas, ropa interior y variedades diversas logrando un equilibrio.
Inicio con poco inventario y ayuda económica de su esposo, lo que ha venido aumentando con los años su comercio atreves de préstamos que la institución ha dado. El cual he aprovechado esta oportunidad de mantener su negocio activo, con productos rotativos, que ha logrado vender variedad lo que le ha permitido la captación de clientes.
Con este financiamiento su propósito es la compra de ropa con dos docenas de pantalón jeans de mujer, dos  docenas de faldas, dos docenas de camisa de varón, trajes de niñas, sandalias, zapatos, ropa interior y variedades.
Como planes es la compra de vitrinas para exhibir sus productos y comprar maniquí para lograr mejor visión. Contenta por la inversión.
texts.en:
Rosa is a busy merchant.  For several years she has sold assorted women’s and children’s clothes and underwear and now has a stable business.

She started out with little inventory and with economic help from her husband.  Gradually she has increased her stock over the years thanks to loans from the institution.  She has taken advantage of this opportunity to keep her business afloat, rotating stock that has made it possible for her to sell greater variety thus acquiring more customers.

This loan’s purpose is to buy two dozen women’s denim pants, two dozen skirts, two dozen men’s shirts, and outfits for girls, sandals, shoes, underwear and other assorted items.

Among her plans are the purchase of display cases to showcase her products and the purchase of a manikin for better appearance.  She’s happy with the investment.

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: William

texts.es: El Señor William dedicado a la producción de puertas y ventanas, también  realiza marcos de las puertas,  cuenta con dos hijos y su esposa,  el solo  mantiene el hogar ya que su esposa se dedica a labores del hogar,  realiza un fuerte trabajo en la carpintería de su primo donde el es propietario de una maquina de las muchas que existen ahí, el deseo de William es aumentar sus maquinas y así formar su micro empresa para realizar muebles, ya que realiza un buen trabajo y tiene mucha clientela, con el dinero del crédito comprara madera para la realización de muebles, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
William manufactures doors and windows; he also builds door frames.  He and his wife have two children and the family depends entirely on him since his wife is a housewife.

He has quite a bit of work in his cousin’s carpentry shop where he is the owner of one of the many machines they have there.  William’s wish is to increase the number of machines thus establishing a micro furniture manufacturing business because he does good work and has many customers.

The money from the loan will be used to buy wood to make furniture.  He is very grateful for the help the institution has given him.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Luisa Ercilia

texts.es:
Luisa tiene su propio negocio, un comedor en donde vende variedad de platillos.
Iniciándolo hace muchos años con la venta de fritanga, que gracias a su tenacidad y empeño por lograr la ayuda económica de su familia logro una buena inversión que es de bastante economía hoy en día.
 Con dinero que su esposo dio, de su trabajo. Con las ganancias comienza a mejorar parte del local. Pero aun no le es suficiente y recurre al financiamiento en donde es Afodenic una puerta a su progreso y logra hacer la compra de utensilios de cocina del comedor, cocina eléctrica, hornos, mesas, sillas.
Las ventas hay días que se vende poco, a si como días buenos que se vende todo, es por esa razón que este financiamiento le da una mejor inversión ya que tiene que mover el dinero. Lo que comprara: granos básicos, productos lácteos, carne de res, carne de cerdo, pollo, gaseosas, jugos, utensilios de mesa, lo que compra en mucha cantidad y que le permite equilibrarse
texts.en:
Luisa has her own business, an eatery where she sells a variety of dishes.

She started her business many years ago selling home-cooked Nicaraguan foods.  Thanks to her tenacity and determination to support her family financially, she made a good investment which is now quite economically sound.

With money which her husband gave her from his work and from her profits, she began to improve part of her premises.  However, it still wasn't enough and so she came to Afrodenic for financing with which she bought cooking utensils, an electric stove, ovens, tables and chairs.

There are days where sales are slow as well as good days where she sells everything.  This loan will help her to buy: basic grains, dairy products, beef, pork, chicken, sodas, juice and cutlery which she will buy in bulk and which will allow her to balance herself out.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, beef, pork, chicken, sodas as well as utensils for the business

loans.name: Agapo

texts.es:
El Señor Agapo Rodríguez Condori, el curso hasta 4to. De primaria, es soltero y no tiene hijos, El es padre y madre para sus tres hermanos que estudian y le ayudan con los quehaceres de su casa, ellos desde muy pequeños se quedaron sin su padre y hace como unos 6 meses es que falleció su madre desde entonces él se dedica a educar y hacerse cargo sus hermanos, el se dedica al servicio de moto taxista en Ivirgarzama hace mas de 3 año, el está afiliado al sindicato de moto taxista "10 de NOVIEMBRE",  en el cual esta hace mas de 3 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.

 Cabe señalar que el señor Agapo Rodríguez Condori, se apersono a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Mr Agapo Rodríguez Condori studied up to his fourth year of elementary school.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  He is mother and father to his three siblings who are still studying and help him with the household chores.  The children have been without their father since they were very young and then 6 months ago their mother died.  Since then, he has been in charge of educating and taking care of them.  He has been working as a motorcycle taxi driver in Ivirgarzama for more than 3 years and is affiliated with the motorcycle taxi drivers' union “10 de Noviembre”.  He has been an active member of the union for more than 3 years.  The service he provides is profitable since a lot of people request this service for its ease, speed and efficiency.  The union has stops and shifts for each member at different points in the town of Ivirgarzama where people turn up to request the service.

This is the first time that this client has obtained a loan from our institution.  He will use it to buy a new motorcycle since the one he has now has already reached the end of its life cycle and in this way he will be able to provide a better service to his customers, improve his income and thereby improve his quality of life.

We must point out that Mr Agapo Rodríguez Condori turned up in person to request his loan since his work colleagues told him about the good credit conditions with which our institution works.

loans.use: To buy a new work tool (motorcycle)

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos trabaja como chofer desde hace mas de 10 años tiene auto propio y vive en domicilio familiar en la zona de Arocagua, actualmente su esposa se encuentra en España se fue a buscar mejores oportunidades de trabajo tiene un solo hijo necesita el crédito para la compra de repuestos de su automóvil ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite realizar un buen servicio a sus clientes,  es nuevo en la institución y con el crédito kiva, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Juan Carlos has been a driver for more than 10 years. He has his own car and he lives in a family neighborhood in the region of Aocagua. His wife is currently in Spain. She went in search of better work opportunities. They only have one son. He requires the loan to purchase spare parts for his car as it is experiencing some malfunctions and it is interfering with the services he provides. He is a new member in the group and to the Kiva program. He is very grateful for the support he has received.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia forma parte del banco comunal “Esperanza y Fe” de la comuna de Independencia. Ella se dedica a la confección de uniformes, buzos y otras prendas por encargo, desde hace más de 40 años. Tiene 3 clientes frecuentes: un hospital, un colegio y un jardín infantil. Trabaja normalmente sola, pero cuando tiene pedidos muy grandes contrata a una persona para que le ayude. 
Con este préstamo comprará telas, hilos, elásticos, cierres y botones. Patricia  ha sido un importante aporte económico para su hija que estudia ingeniería en turismo en la universidad. Su meta más cercana es comprar una máquina especial para terminaciones y su sueño es cambiarse de casa a una más grande e instalar allí un taller de costuras.  
Patricia siente que en Fondo Esperanza ha podido realizarse como persona, gracias  al apoyo que ha recibido, no solo económico, sino que en la orientación sobre cómo administrar mejor su negocio. 
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Se caracteriza por la presencia de edificios de mediana altura. Aquí se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile, entre otros 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the community bank named "Hope and Faith" in the community of Independencia. She makes uniforms, sweaters, and other clothing items. She has been taking orders for more than 40 years. She has 3 regular clients: a hospital, a school, and a day care center. She usually works alone but when she has very large orders she hires someone to help her. 

This loan will be used to purchase fabrics, threads, elastics, zippers, and buttons. Patricia has been an important financial support for her daughter who is studying engineering tourism in university. Her short term goal is to purchase a special machine to add finishing touches and her dream is to have a larger home where she can set up a tailoring shop. 

Patricia feels that within her community bank she has been able to improve herself. Thanks to the support she has received, not only financially speaking, but also in the orientation on how to better manage her business.

Independencia is one of the 34 communities that make up the city of Santiago (capital city of Chile). It is located in the northern central region of the country and the city boasts medium sized buildings. The Indigenous Peoples Cultural Centre of Chile is and 6 other historical monuments are located in this city.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, threads, elastics, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Jennifer Juliana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Guerra De Los Sexos  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jennifer, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años y cinco meses. Su marido es mecánico y trabaja en un taller de carros. Ella estudia el segundo semestre de educación básica en la Universidad tecnológica Equinoccial.
 
Se dedica al hogar y también al comercio, vende productos Yanbal (productos de cosméticos, belleza, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana desde las 13h00 hasta las 18h00. Nos cuenta que tiene varios clientes que le realizan los pedidos.

Este crédito es para pagar los pedidos de este mes y otra parte para pagar una parte de los gastos que tiene en su universidad, este es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque desde que entro ha recibido mucho apoyo de parte de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo. Su sueño es terminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "La Guerra de Los Sexos" meets every fortnight in the parish Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a well-known commercial area with its traditional fiestas of San Pedro and San Pablo and contains a rich historical culture in the mountains.

Here we met Jennifer, 23 years old, and married with one child who is 2 years and five months old.  Her husband is a mechanic and works at a car shop.  She is studying her second semester of basic education in La Universidad Tecnologica Equinoccial (Equinox University of Technology).

She is dedicated to the household and also to trade.  She sells Yanbal products (cosmetic products, beauty products, perfumes, and accessories for women).  She works three days a week from 1:00 PM to 6:00 PM.  She tells us that she has several clients that have put in orders.

This loan is to pay for the orders for this months and also to pay a portion of her school expenses.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because since she entered, she has received much support from her friends and fellow group members.  Her dream is to finish her college career.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, perfumes, jewelry, and also pay for educational expenses.

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es: La señorita Sara  María T. T. inicio con su negocio hace 10 años necesita un refinanciamiento  para poder trabajar en la venta de comida típica  para la celebración del día de los santos que es celebrado el primero de noviembre  de cada año es soltera vive con sus papas y el mayor deseo que tiene ahora es poder tener otra venta de comida para generar más ingresos y poder surtir mas sus diferentes ventas ya que le han hecho pedidos de comida  y necesita tener más capital  para su negocio la señora solicita el credito para comprar insumos para la elavoracion de comida
