Rosa is a widow in the city of Quito.  She arrived there 10 years ago and has stayed for her children's education and because there are better work opportunities.  She sells staples and toiletries, which she has done for 20 years.  She also makes fruit salad and Chilean style eggs that are well liked.  She does traveling sales and works from Monday to Saturday from 8 am to 6 pm.

This is her second loan and she plans to invest it in the purchase of products such as toothpaste, toilet paper, etc., as sales inventory.  Her goal is to have her own place to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy toothpaste, toilet paper, soap, etc.

loans.name: Corazoncitos I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Corazoncitos I porque todas las integrantes consideran que son de buen corazón. Se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes.La señora María de Jesús  Méndez es la Presidenta del grupo. Tiene 38 años, estudió hasta quinto semestre de la carrera de  administración, es comerciante y tiene en total dos hijos; un varón y una mujer. Ella se dedica a la venta de lencería y zapatos que inició desde hace tres años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de los productos que vende ya que cuando compra por mayoreo le realizan un buen descuento. Sus clientes opinan que es una persona muy amable y siempre los trata con mucho respeto, ella trata de mantener a sus clientes complacidos. Inició su negocio en el municipio de Tula en donde tenía pocos clientes pero al cambiar su lugar de residencia a Pachuca se ha consolidado como una buena vendedora y el número de clientes ha ido en aumento. Al solicitar este préstamo se sintió ilusionada y feliz porque ahora podrá cumplir con lo que les prometió a sus clientes.Quiere este crédito para surtir algunos pedidos que ya le solicitaron. También espera en un futuro no muy lejano construir un local afuera de su casa para que de esta manera incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
This group is called “Corazoncitos I” [Hearts] because its members regard themselves as people with good hearts. It is made up of 9 members, and they are in the State of Hidalgo in Mexico. Mrs. Maria de Jesus M. is the group’s president. She is 38 years old and has two children, a son and a daughter. She completed five semesters of Business Administration and has been a merchant for three years selling lingerie and shoes.
She requests the loan to buy merchandise wholesale, because wholesale purchases grant her a good discount. Her costumers consider her a kind person who treats them with respect and she strives to keep them satisfied.  
Mrs. M. started her business in the town of Tula where she had few costumers but after her moving to Pachuca, she has proven to be a good salesperson and the number of costumers is steadily increasing. 
She feels happy and hopeful requesting this loan because it would allow her to fulfill several orders already placed by some of her costumers. She also hopes to build a place for her business outside of her house which would help her to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, de 48 años, está casada con Lorenzo, de 50 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo cuidan de 2 de ellos, las que se encuentran en la capital del país, cursando estudios superiores. Ellos viven en una casa alquila ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). Para poder solventar los gastos educativos de sus hijas y la enfermedad de su esposo, ella se dedica a trabajar como profesora de educación inicial a niños menores de 5 años en un jardín del centro de la ciudad. Pero como buena mujer; hace 3 años que se dedica a los trabajos de redacción e impresiones, en la computadora que tiene en casa, de la misma manera tienen una fotocopiadora con la que puede implementar su servicio. En los tiempos libres que son muy pocos, Maritza, se consagra a servir a la parroquia como sacristana, y catequista.  “Dios, me ayuda y me da fuerzas, en estos momentos difíciles”, asegura. Por ello más adelante desea alquilar un local comercial, donde pueda brindar mejor sus servicios y tener mayores ingresos. Maritza, como buena integrante de su banco comunal, es una mujer líder. Ya es el séptimo crédito con MFP y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que recibe. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá adquirir papeles e insumos, para su computadora, con lo cual podrá seguir brindando su servicio de redacción.
texts.en:
Maritza, age 48, is married to 50 year old Lorenzo.  They have five children, but they are taking care of only two of them.  The children are in the capital of the country taking courses in higher education.

Maritza and her husband live in a rented house in the city of La Merced (central Peruvian jungle).  In order to pay for her daughters’ educational expenses and for her husband’s illness, Maritza works in a nursery school in the center of the city as a preschool teacher for children less than five years old. 

As a good wife, she has worked for three years writing and printing on the computer that she has at home.  They also have a photocopier, which she can use for her service.

In the small amount of free time she has Maritza devotes herself to the parish as a sexton and catechist.  “God helps me and gives me strength in these difficult times”,  she says.

Later she wishes to rent a commercial place where she can provide better services and have greater income.  

Maritza, as a good member of her communal bank, is a leader.  This is her seventh loan with MFP.  She is very grateful for the help she receives.  She will use the requested loan to get papers and supplies for her computer.  That way she will be able to continue offering her writing services.

loans.use: To buy paper and supplies in order to offer her writing services

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 35 años, es una mujer luchadora; hace tan solo 2 años que se separó de su esposo; pero como una madre responsable cuida de sus 2 hijos: Kainer, de 12 y Rocío, de 7 años. Desde entonces se convirtieron en una familia muy unida, que viven en casa de su madre, ubicada en la localidad de Casacoto. Cuando vivía, con su esposo; ella tenía un pequeño puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma, ahí vendía verduras a los pobladores que visitaban el mercado; pero como la inestabilidad económica llegó a su hogar producto de su separación, ella decide dedicarse a la agricultura, es así que con el apoyo de su madre, se establece en el pueblo, donde comienza a sembrar papa y maíz. Sus productos son muy buenos, y en cada cosecha que obtiene, puede ver sus esfuerzos plasmados, asimismo lleva esta mercadería fuera de la capital, donde negocia su producción a buen precio. Pero como trabajadora incansable, ella por las noches vende hamburguesa, en la esquina de su casa. Así cada día agradece a Dios por el apoyo que le brinda, y desea seguir sembrando y ganar más experiencia. Es el primer crédito con MFP y, está  feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde las personas son emprendedoras, que triunfan a pesar de las dificultades. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 8 sacos de abono, para su cultivo de papa que recién sembró.
texts.en:
Maribel, age 35, is a tenacious woman.  It has only been two years since she separated from her husband, but as a responsible mother she takes care of her two children.  Kainer is 12, and Rocío is 7.  Since that time they became a very united family.  They live in her mother’s house, which is located in Casacoto.

When she lived with her husband she had a small stand in the central market in the city of Tarma.  She sold vegetables to the people who came to the market.  However, due to the economic instability that came to her household because of her separation, she decided to work in agriculture.  That is why, with her mother’s support, she set herself up in the village where she is starting to grow potatoes and corn.  Her products are very good, and her efforts are reflected in each harvest.

She also takes her merchandise outside of the capital, where she negotiates a good price for her production.  She is a tireless hard-worker, and she sells hamburgers at night on the corner of her house.  Every day she is grateful to God for the support He gives her.  She wishes to keep farming and to gain more experience.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is happy to belong to her communal bank.  The members are enterprising, and they triumph in spite of the difficulties.  She will use the requested loan to buy eight sacks of fertilizer for her potato crop, which she recently planted.

loans.use: To buy eight sacks of fertilizer for her potato crop

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora, de 40 años, está casada con Florián, de 43 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos, José, de 16 años y Jesús, de 2 años de edad. A los que cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada, en la localidad Sangani. Hace 3 años, que se dedica a la agricultura, donde siembra café, en sus 3 hectáreas de terreno agrícola. Donde después de cada cosecha, vende en el mercado central de su localidad. Pero, lo que más le gusta a ella, es el trabajo de profesora, actividad que desempeña hace ya algunos años. Sin embargo añora aquellos tiempos en los que toda la familia compartía momentos gratos en los cuidados que le brindaban a sus plantaciones. Por ello quiere seguir sembrando, pero en mayores cantidades para obtener una buena producción. Más adelante planea abrir una librería en su casa, ya que no existe una en su localidad. Es el sexto crédito con MFP y se siente orgullosa de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde todo este tiempo pudo aprender a surgir y salir adelante. Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá invertir en el mantenimiento de sus cafetales; ya que está recultivando (renovando plantaciones de café), para la temporada que se avecina.
texts.en:
Teodora, age 40, is married to 43 year old Florián.  They have two children, 16 year old José and 2 year old Jesús.  They take care of the children and are raising them in their own house in Sangani.

She has been growing coffee on three hectares of farmland for three years.  After every harvest she sells the coffee at the central market in her area.  However, what she likes the most is teaching, which she has done for some years.  Nevertheless, she yearns for the times that the whole family shared good times taking care of their crops.  That is why she wants to keep farming, but in greater quantities in order to get good production.

Later, she plans to open a bookshop in her house because there are none in her area.

This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She is proud to belong to her communal bank, where she was able to learn to excel and get ahead.  She will use the loan for upkeep of her coffee fields.  She is again preparing the land for growing coffee for the coming season.

loans.use: Maintenance and care for her coffee crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Maintenance and repair expenses for his mototaxi

loans.name: Vida Plena (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Vida Plena esta conformado por 13 mujeres y un hombre, quienes se dedican a un trabajo especifico que es la venta de productos naturales, con este trabajo han logrado mejorar la economía de sus hogares, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de C., esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes, por sus cuatro ríos que la bañan, su gran variedad de gastronomía, su gente y su cultura.

La Señora Martha P. vive por el sector de Uncovia en la ciudad de C., este es su primer crédito y ha sido invitada por su suegra. Tiene 18 año,  vive en unión libre y tiene un hija de 3 meses de edad, su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros.
Nuestra socia por el momento se encuentra al cuidado de su hija, pero va a iniciar con su crédito  la venta de productos naturales como son los productos de Omnilife. su meta es   salir adelante con su negocio.

La Señora. Carmen Pérez vive por la estación de cumbe, tiene 38 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad que esta estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive con sus padres  y comparte los gastos del hogar.
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, fue invitada por su hermana a formar parte de este grupo. Se dedica a la cría de animales como borregos, gallinas, cuyes, también posee ganado de leche es vendida a los carros distribuidores de leche, su primer crédito lo va a invertir en iniciar el negocio de la venta de productos naturales como son los productos de Omnilife. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.

NOTA: En la foto se encuentra el Sr. Eulogio Rojas que es el coordinador de la Fundación en la regional Azuay.
texts.en:
The "Vida Plena" [full life] Communal Bank is made up of 13 women and one man, who sell natural products, and have thereby improved their household incomes. They live in different places in the city of C., which is known for its beautiful landscapes, its four flowing rivers, its great gastronomic variety, its people, and its culture.

Mrs. Martha P. lives in the Uncovia area of C.. This is her first loan and she was invited by her mother-in-law. She is 18 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has a 3-month-old daughter. Her husband works as a security guard. They don't have their own house, so she lives with her in-laws.

Our associate, for the moment, is caring for her daughter, but with her loan she is going to start selling natural products such as Omnilife products. Her goal is to improve her situation with her business.

Mrs. Carmen Pérez lives by the station at the top of the mountain. She is 38 years old, single, and has a 14 year old son who is studying at a school in the city. She does not have her own house, so she lives with her parents and shares the household expenses.

This is her first loan through the communal bank. She was invited by her sister to be part of this group. She raises animals such as sheep, hens, and guinea pigs. She also owns dairy cows, and the milk is sold to mobile milk distributors. She is going to invest her first loan in starting a business selling natural products such as Omnilife products. Her dream is to have her own house.

NOTE: Also pictured in the photo is Mr Eulogio Rojas, who is the Fundación coordinator in the Azuay region.

loans.use: Purchase Omnilife products.

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el sector Montegrande del distrito de Reque, una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la comercialización de alfalfa y otros tipos de forrajes. El empezó a trabajar en el negocio ayudando a su padrastro y con el tiempo ha logrado empezar a trabajar por su cuenta sin dejar de apoyarlo. Jesús comercializa sus productos entre los ganaderos de Chosica del Norte (una zona aledaña al lugar en donde reside), el Mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la región) y otros lugares en donde tiene menos clientela.

Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades el se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia con el mantenimiento de su economía. Jesús desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas alfalfa y forraje de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir más ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Jesús es una persona tranquila y bastante entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. En la imagen aparece cortando el forraje que venderá a sus clientes.
texts.en: Jesús is 18 years old, single and lives with his parents in the Montegrande sector of the Reque district, a zone located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For four years he has sold alfalfa and other types of fodder. He started working in this business helping his step-father, and with time he has been able to work for himself without stopping helping his stepfather. Jesús sells his products among the farmers of Chosica del norte (a zone bordering the area where he lives), in the Moshoqueque Market (a wholesale market in the region) and other areas where he has less customers. With the income that he makes from these activities he covers his personal costs and helps his family with their household costs. Jesús wants to expand his business by acquiring more alfalfa and fodder in order to increase his sales and make more income. For this reason, he has decided to request his first loan, 500 soles, from Edpyme Alternativa. Jesús is a calm person who is very dedicated to his family. Those who know him consider him to be an enterprising person who has a great desire to succeed. In the photo he is cutting fodder to sell to his customers.

loans.use: The purchase of fodder to expand the fodder sales business.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es: Brígida, D. 57 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eusebio D. 65 años y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila, ya que a su edad ya se dio el gusto D. formar y sacar adelante a sus 3 queridos hijos. El lugar más conocido para comprar ropa es en la ciudad D. San Francisco (Ayacucho), es un pequeño mercado llamado “Gamarrita”, es aquí donD. Brígida tiene su puesto D. venta. En este lugar atienD. a todos sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía, quienes visitan continuamente su puesto, debido a los bonitos y novedosos modelos D. ropa que trae personalmente D. la ciudad D. Lima. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre las prendas que mejor les quedan, ya que D. esta manera se distrae un poco, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto D. venta, ya que abre a las 5 D. la mañana y trabaja hasta aproximadamente las 10 D. la noche. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda más granD., en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socia, muy alegre y siempre esta poniendo la cuota D. humor en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa D. Lima, D. preferencia ropa D. verano, ya que este tipo D. ropa es la que más se venD. en esta parte D. la selva peruana.
texts.en:
Bridget, 57, is a simple and hard working woman, who lives in her own home with her husband Eusebio, 65. What she wants most, is to live out her old age peacefully because at her age she had the pleasure of being able to raise her 3 dear children.

The most popular place to buy clothes is in the city of San Francisco (Ayacucho); it is a small market called "Gamarrita" and this is where Bridget has her stand. This is where she serves all her clients with great kindness and courtesy, customers who visit regularly because of the beautiful and new models of clothes she brings personally from the city of Lima. 

What she likes about her job is advising her clients about the clothes that fit them best because in this way they relax a bit.   She has been doing this for 30 years and believes that the hardest part is having to spend all day in her stall.  It opens at 5 am and she works until about 10 pm. In time, she would like to have a larger store where she can proviD. better service to her customers. 

This is her sixth loan with MFP and she knows she has to make all her payments on time if she wants to access another loan in the future and is willing to do so. She is a very cheerful  member of her communal bank and always contributes her share of  humor in meetings. With the three thousand soles requested, she will buy more clothes in Lima, preferably summer clothes, as this type of clothing is the best selling in this part of the Peruvian jungle.

loans.use: To buy more clothing in Lima to stock her store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, D. 54 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Tito D. 54 años y sus 3 menores hijos, los cuales todavía dependen económicamente D. ella y lo que más desea es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. DesD. muy joven a Delia le nació el gusto por las prendas D. vestir, es por eso que con el tiempo decidió dedicarse a la venta D. ropa, actualmente realizando una ardua labor semanal, lleva ropa para vender a la ciudad D. San Antonio (Ayacucho), ya que según manifiesta es ahí donD. mejores precios obtiene por sus prendas, las cuales ella misma se encarga D. comprar y transportar desD. la ciudad D. Lima. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que están D. moda en la capital, ya que así siente que se gana la confianza D. sus compradores, lleva 32 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar los pesados fardos D. ropa, pero aun así no se da por vencida, ya que sabe que D. esta actividad depenD. el bienestar D. su familia. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda en la ciudad D. San Francisco, en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y siempre esta pendiente del bienestar D. sus compañeros. Con los mil  nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa D. la ciudad D. Lima, sobre todo prendas D. verano, ya que este tipo D. ropa es la más utilizada en esta parte D. la selva Peruana.
texts.en: Delia, 54 years old, is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband Tito, 54 years old, and their three youngest children, who still depend on her economically. What she wants most is to proviD. for her family a better quality of life. She has had an interest in clothes since she was very young, and it is because of this and the timing that she decided to make a living selling clothing. She carries out this labor intensive job. She brings the clothes to sell in the city of San Antonio (Ayacucho), because it is there that gets the best prices for her clothing items. She herself buys these items and transports them from the city of Lima. What she likes most about her job is to advise her clients regarding which clothes are in fashion in the capital city. In this way she feels that she gains the confidence of those who purchase from her. She has been doing this line of work for 32 years and she thinks that the most difficult part of the job is to have to transport the weighty bundles of clothing. However, she does not let herself be defeated by this because she knows that the wellbeing of her family depends on it. Over time, she hopes to have her own store in the city of San Francisco, which could proviD. a better service to her clients. This is her first loan with MFP, and she will pay all of the installments punctually, as she wishes to be eligible for another loan sooner. In her communal bank she is a very supportive member and she is always thinking of the well being of the other members. With the one thousand soles she is asking for, she will buy more clothing from Lima, especially summer clothing items, since these items are the most utilized in this part of the Peruvian jungle.

loans.use: To buy more clothing items from the city of Lima, to meet the demand of her clients.

loans.name: Alma Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama ALMA, porque así se llama una D. las integrantes del grupo y les gusta el significado D. ese nombre. Está ubicado en el Estado D. México.  El grupo está conformado por  11 integrantes. Diana Verónica C. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 38 años, estudió para secretaria Ejecutiva, es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijas mujeres.  Ella se dedica a poner uñas y venta D.  perfumes negocio que inició hace 20 años y 4 años en la colocación D. uñas. Solicita el préstamo para surtirse más D. perfumes y para las compras D. material para la colocación D. uñas. Sus clientas son vecinas D. la misma comunidad y conocidas. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente ilusionada.   Quiere este crédito para poder hacer crecer sus ventas y tener más ingresos personales. También espera poder apoyar en los ingresos D. su hogar.
texts.en:
This group is known as ALMA [Soul], because it's one of the member's names and also because they like it's meaning. This group is in the state of Mexico and is maD. up of 11 members. 

Diana Veronica C. is a 38 year old member who studied to be an executive secretary and is a business woman with two daughters. She makes a living applying decorative fingernails as well as selling perfume. She has been selling perfume for 20 years and applying fingernails for 4. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase more perfumes as well as materials to apply the nails. Her clients are her neighbors from the community. As she requests the loan she is quite excited. She wants this loan to be able to increase her sales and have more personal income. She also hopes to add to the household income.

loans.use: Purchase inventory and invest in her business

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia, de 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rómulo de 39 años y sus 2 querido hijos Jover de 17 y Pamela de 10 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Con el único deseo de sacar adelante a su familia, Dionisia se embarca semanalmente a la región de Junín llevando fardos de ropa para vender en la ciudad de Huancayo, que son adquiridas dichas prendas en Lima, motivo por el cual son rápidamente compradas, ya que son muy bonitas y novedosas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que mejor les quedan, ya que así puede ganarse el cariño de sus compradores, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus fardos de ciudad en ciudad, ya que esta actividad la cansa mucho. Con el tiempo, desea abrir una tienda en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que es muy solidaria. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa de la ciudad de Lima, con lo cual implementara mejor su stock de ventas.
texts.en:
Dionisia is a jovial and hardworking 37 year old who lives in her own home with her 39 year old husband Romulo and their two children Jover (17) and Pamela (10). Their children are the driving force behind all their efforts. In hopes of seeing her family succeed, Dionisia heads weekly to the Junin region with bundles of clothing to sell in the city of Huancayo. The clothing is purchased in Lima and is attractive and modern, reason for which it sells quickly. 

She enjoys helping her customers choose their clothing most about her work. That is how she earns their affection. She has been doing this for 3 years and feels that the hardest part is transporting the bundles from city to city since it is quite tiring. 

In the future she hopes to open a store in the city of San Francisco where she could serve her customers better. This is her second loan with MFP and she knows that she has to make her payments on time and is willing to do so. She is a well liked member of her community bank since she is very supportive. With the two thousand Nuevos Soles she has requested she will buy more clothing in Lima which will increase her inventory and sales.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in Lima to increase her inventory

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín, de 42 años, es un hombre muy humilde y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su querida hija Karen de 5 años, de quien es el único sustento, ya que actualmente vive separado de su esposa y lo que más desea es poderle brindar un buen futuro a su hija. Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajando a veces casi 18 horas diarias, Efraín ha logrado darle a su pequeña hija la educación que se merece. En su taller de electrónicos repara todo tipo de artefactos, pero en lo que es el especialista del pueblo, es en arreglar artefactos de refrigeración, ya que así sea una refrigeradora, congeladora o una cámara frigorífica, él con mucha astucia y la experiencia que le brindan los años, las deja como nuevos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es arreglar artefactos de refrigeración, ya que sabe que con el intenso calor que hace en esta parte del país, la gente depende mucho de ellos, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es conseguir los repuesto que necesitan los artefactos. Con el tiempo, desea ampliar su taller, para así poder atender a más clientes a la vez. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más repuestos, los cuales mandará a traer desde la ciudad de Lima con los cuales espera poder arreglar mejor los artefactos.
texts.en:
Efraín, 42 years old, is a very humble and hardworking man. He lives in a rented house together with his beloved daughter Karen, 5 years old, the only one he supports, since he is separated from his wife. What he wants most is to be able to provide a good future for his daughter. 

With great effort, working sometimes almost 18 hours per day, Efraín has succeeded in giving his young child the education that she deserves. In his electronics shop he repairs all types of items, but he is known in the town as a specialist in fixing refrigeration devices. Whether it be a refrigerator, a freezer or a cold store, with the astuteness and the experience that his years provide him, they are like new when he is done. What he likes most about his work is to fix refrigeration devices. Because of the intense heat in this part of the country, the people depend on these devices greatly. 

He has been in this line of work for 25 years and he considers the most difficult part of the job to be obtaining the replacement parts that are needed. Over time he would like to expand his workshop so that he can attend to more clients at the same time. This is his seventh loan with MFP, and he knows that this investment will be very beneficial in the development of his work. 

In his communal bank he is a very responsible member and very respected. With the three thousand soles he is asking for, he will buy more replacement parts, which he will have sent from the city of Lima. With these, he hopes to be able to better fix the devices.

loans.use: To buy replacement parts to fix refrigeration devices.

loans.name: Noel's Group

texts.en: Noel N. is from the village of Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old. Noel is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults. Noel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Noel raises pigs for sale. Noel has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Noel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Noel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Noel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary O. is from Calabayan Ozamis City. She is 24 years old. Rosemary is the group leader for a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosemary is single and has one child, who is an infant. To make a living, Rosemary owns and operates a  specialized retail store. This is not her only means of generating income.  The main source of income comes from selling gasoline in the local community. Rosemary is just starting this business.

In 2010, Rosemary joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemary is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosemary from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Analiza's Group

texts.en:
Analiza S. is from the village of San Niholas Tudela, Misamis Occidental.  She is 40 years old. Analiza is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Analiza is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Analiza owns and operates a business raising fish for sale. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from purchasing and selling fish and shrimps in the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Analiza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Analiza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
 
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chilly

texts.en:
Chilly O. is 39 years old and from District III, Sibalom, Antique, Philippines.  She is married to Lucas O..  She is not only a loving wife but a very responsible mother of Frelyn, Lovelyn, Lory Ben, Lory Jan, Cherry Me and Loren Je.  All of their children are still studying and that is why the couple really stretched their bones just to earn an income in order to sustain the basic needs of the family.

As parents, they want to give a bright future to their children so they really strive hard in order to send their children to school despite poverty because they believe that the only weapon to fight poverty is through education.  

Since her 2008 membership in ASHI, she never fails to carry out her responsibilities especially in repayment.  On the other hand, she maintains her good performance, so that is why she received a bigger loan and other incentive loans from ASHI. 

For her next loan she is applying for 19,000 PHP and this will be used as additional capital for her farming project.  

Someday if ASHI and KIVA will grant her a bigger loan, she is also planning to indulge in poultry raising and she is planning to buy farm machines to have bigger production. She aims that their children will reach the peak of success through their hardship and support of the institution.

loans.use: Farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.)

loans.name: Coquetas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Coquetas, por el buen humor que tienen las integrantes. Está ubicado en el Estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes.La señora María Luisa B. es la tesorera del grupo, tiene 33 años estudio hasta el bachillerato, es comerciante y tiene en total 5 hijos. Ella se dedica a vender productos de temporada y tiene una tienda de abarrotes, que inicio hace 10 años. Solicita préstamo para comprar fruta y flor, para la temporada navideña.Sus clientes se sienten contentos porque en diferentes temporadas del año pueden comprarle y no tener que salir a otra comunidad. Al solicitar este préstamo ella se siente con un apoyo diferente al de su familia ya que con este préstamo podrá tener una mejor casa para sus hijos.Espera seguir teniendo estos préstamos para darles mejores estudios a sus hijos, y así puedan tener un mejor trabajo. Su sueño es tener locales de ropa y tiendas de abarrotes en comunidades rurales para que las personas de su comunidad no tengan que salir lejos a conseguir lo que necesitan.
texts.en: This group is called 'Coquetas' (Flirts) because its members have a good sense of humor.  The group is located in the state of Mexico and has 11 members.  Mrs María Luisa B. is the group's treasurer.  She is 33 years old and studied through senior high school.  She is a saleswoman and has 5 children.  She sells seasonal products and has a grocery store which she set up 10 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy fruits and flowers for the Christmas season.  Her customers are happy because throughout the different seasons of the year they can buy from her and don't have to travel to another community.  As she requests her loan, she is pleased to have support from a source other than her family since with this loan she will be able to have a better house for her children.  She hopes to continue receiving these loans so that she can support her children in their studies and thereby help them to get better jobs.  Her dream is to have clothes stores and grocery stores in rural communities so that people from these communities don't have to travel far to buy what they need.

loans.use: To buy fruit and flowers for the Christmas season

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
A simple and religious woman: these words simply describe Raquel P., one of the active members of ASHI ASE. She is 34 years old and from District II, Sibalom, Antique, Philippines.  She is married to Nestor P. and they are blessed with two children, Arthur and Marie Elzevir P., both of whom are still studying.

She is not only active in ASHI but she also served as a BEC (Basic Ecclesiastical Community) coordinator of Sta. Rita de Acasia Parish Church.

For almost three years in ASHI she never gave any problems to the center; instead, she was an aid to solve any problems and conflicts in the center. She is very helpful to those who are in need because she believes that what you have done to others also returns to you twice. 

The family earns their living through farming and the income that they get from this business is used to buy their basic needs. Since the rice planting season is approaching, she needs capital to buy some farm inputs like pesticides, insecticides, certified seeds and for pay for the laborers. She needs 25,000 PHP for her business.

Her dreams are to widen the land that they own, that her children will finish their studies up to college and to put up a comfortable concrete house someday.

loans.use: For farming

loans.name: Mary Vic

texts.en: Mary Vic D. C. is from the village of Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old, married and has 1 infant. To make a living, Mary Vic owns and operates a business venture selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Mary Vic has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Mary Vic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Vic is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Vic from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo G. is from the village of Barangay Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 39 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Danilo owns and operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2007, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Danilo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Elma's Group

texts.en:
Elma E. is from the village of Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Elma is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lerio.

Elma is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a clothing business, selling new clothes to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena B. is from the pottery capital of Antique, Bari, Sibalom, Antique, Philippines. She is 36 years old, a widow and the mother of three children. Her eldest child is 15 years old while the youngest is 7 years old. They are all students.

Like other mothers she is always hoping for the betterment of her children and the whole family. When she became a widow, she had difficulty in providing for the needs of the family, but she is the kind of mother who does not give up, especially in providing the needs of her children.

Because of her personality and abilities, she was elected as center chief of Bari center 6 of the ASHI Antique Southeast Branch. As a member, she maintains her good performance because she believes that a leader must be a good follower.

She earns an income through buying and selling pottery. The income that she earns from this business really helps her to sustain the basic needs of her family, especially the educational expenses of her children.

For her next loan, she wishes to apply for 25,000 PHP. This amount will be used as additional capital in her pottery business.

Her greatest dream is that all of her children will finish their studies so that they can get a better job. She also dreams of getting a bigger income out of this business so they can own a house and lot someday.

loans.use: To buy more pottery to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn Mindo Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is from Prenza, Tangub City. She is 42 years old. Jocelyn is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jocelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products like soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, salt, cooking oil and so on in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $48 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bonifacia's Group

texts.en:
Bonifacia D. is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old and the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Pineapple 2.

Bonifacia is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates general store, with the main source of income for the business coming from selling fruit in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $71 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bonifacia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma P. is a married woman who lives in Purok Paghidaet, Brgy. RSB, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store.  Her husband Rulyn P., who is 45 years old, works as a Chief Electrician to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 10 and 16 years old. 

Gemma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 22 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gemma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 23rd cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use to buy additional items for the general  store so that she could continue to save up for future home repair. Gemma P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.name: Susime

texts.en:
Susime D. N. is a 49-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  a salt and dry shrimp business and a tricycle transport businesses. She lives in Purok Okra, Brgy. Palaka Sur, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her salt and dry shrimp and tricycle transport businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000. 

Susime is now borrowing PHP 29,000 so that she  could fund her business operations.  This will be her 21st loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Susime aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is 30 years old, married and with two children, ages four and one and a half years.  For two years he has been selling household items for a living.  On the side, he is also an herbalist.  Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to him because he has developed a saving culture.  This has helped him in managing his finances.  In five years, he wants to transform his business into a wholesale business.  Samwel has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy sufurias (cooking pot), Vikombe (cups) and thermos flasks.

loans.use: To buy sufurias (cooking pot), cups and thermos flasks.

loans.name: Makau

texts.en: Makau, a 30 year old man, is a very hardworking businessman.  He is the father of one child.  He started his charcoal sales business seven years ago.  Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused on his business.  He has employed two people in his business.  Makau also earns extra income from farming.  He hopes to own rental houses in five years.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy G. is a married woman who lives in Purok Alugbati, Brgy. Palaka Sur, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  general store, recycling materials and pig fattening businesses.  Her husband Rolando G., who is 50 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are 11 to 30 years old. 

Mercy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mercy  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus lifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 21st cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use to buy stocks for the general store and rice to sell so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Mercy  G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 22-year-old single man.  He runs a grocery store and also sells charcoal.  Its three years now since he started the business.  He also runs a retail shop so as to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to run his business professionally.  He hopes to have a family and to stabilize his business in the future.  He sees himself growing his business into a wholesale business in the future.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy onions, beans, maize, bananas and lettuce.

loans.use: To buy onions, beans, maize, bananas and lettuce.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella S. is a 55-year old widow who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: ambulant vending of household products and a chainsaw business. She lives in Purok Naga, Benicuil, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her ambulant vending of household products and chainsaw businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Bella is now borrowing PHP 17,000 so that she could purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Bella aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a 26 year old mechanic.  He does vehicle repairs to earn a living.  Having been in the business for eight years, he hopes that someday, he will open his own vehicle maintenance company. Benson also makes detergents to earn extra income.  With his income, he is able to provide for his family as well as educate his two children, ages five and two year.  He has requested his first loan of 20,000 KES to buy a laptop for motor vehicle diagnosis.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for motor vehicle diagnosis.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 36-year-old married man who is blessed with three children. To support his family, Paul repairs kitchen appliances, such as bakery equipment, for a fee. Most of his customers are bakery owners. Paul has been running this business for five years. He has been able to improve his business through the financial support of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy materials for carrying out repairs to wires and consumer units.

loans.use: To buy materials for repairing wires and consumer units

loans.name: Mulinge

texts.en: Mulinge is 31 years old, married and blessed with two children aged; four and seven years old.  For nine years, he has been selling chicken.  With his income, he is able to provide for his family as well as educate his children.  Apart from selling chicken, he is a farmer who grows maize so as to earn extra income.  He hopes to open other branches for his business in the future.  He has requested 60,000 KES to buy chicken.

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 42-year-old member of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, registered under the Lady Lee group. The group members support each other by guaranteeing each other's loans and sharing business ideas. Judith joined this group of entrepreneurs as a businesswoman who sells mainly clothes. She has been running her business for five and a half years, and also runs a grocery business to generate extra income. Judith hopes to improve her standard of living in the future. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy clothes, shoes and bedsheets.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and bedsheets

loans.name: Dinara Chilpakbaeva's Group

texts.en:
Every country in the world is unique in its own way. Kyrgyzstan is no exception. It’s famous for its colorful culture and traditions. Many women are talented in designing clothing and accessories. Handmade souvenirs, carpets and national costumes cannot leave anyone indifferent. Small sewing businesses have turned into big fashion industries, which bring profit both to Kyrgyz entrepreneurs and foreign buyers.
Dinara C., 32, is a unique designer of national souvenirs. Dinara, her husband and their two children are residents of Tokmok, a small town in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. Since her early childhood, she watched her mother make these Kyrgyz traditional handmade souvenirs. Now she works in a small firm “Kiyal”, where she has an opportunity to sell her products. Dinara’s husband is involved in construction and repairing buildings. Her mother helps her out with taking care of the children while she is at work. If the family is fortunate enough to get this loan, they plan to purchase a computer. They would also like to broaden their business by opening their own workshop.
Mirlan C., 35, earns a living by reselling livestock. He is married and his wife helps him in taking care of the livestock. The purpose of his loan is to purchase additional livestock.
Paktagul J., 50, owns a sauna. This business has helped her for many years. She is requesting a loan to buy coal and heat the sauna to attract more customers.
Saadat O., 18, sells jeans clothing in the nearby town of Almaty, Kazakhstan. She plans to spend this loan on additional goods and improving her newly bought apartment.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Rosalinda's Group

texts.en:
Rosalinda T. is from the village of Malibangcao Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Rosalinda is the leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosalinda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda sells food, mainly barbecue. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosalinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosalinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Malika Chynybaeva's Group

texts.en:
The southern regions of Kyrgyzstan are very rich in terms of fruits and vegetables. Their generous soil brings millions of tons of fresh crops every year. Dried fruits are very popular too. Rare sorts of fruits give the Kyrgyz government a promising future in exporting food supplies.
Malika C., 23, sells vegetables and fruits at the central market of Tokmok. She is a young mother of a three-year-old child and helps her parents financially. Her husband works at the firm “Stroi Service”. Malika hopes to have a greener future for her family and works hard to improve her business. She has applied for a loan to increase her goods and increase her profits. She and her husband plan to purchase a house and an automobile.
Zarima A., 26, works in a mosque in Tokmok. She is married and has two children. The purpose of her loan is to buy coal for the winter.
Khamrabai J., 25, is involved in a cell-phone business in the market of Tokmok. The purpose of this loan is to buy additional goods and resell them to make a good profit.
Bakhtiyar A., 27, constructs houses and apartments. He plans to start a fruit and vegetable business. This loan will be spent on purchasing goods for starting up his business.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina V. is a widow who lives in Purok Tuway, Brgy. Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, a smocking business and a ready-to-wear clothes business. Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 7,500 PHP, thus improving her family's standard of living.
This time, for her 17th loan, Gina is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she could continue to save up to make improvements to her business in the future. Gina V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Suyun's Group

texts.en:
Kyrgyzstan is actively seeking overseas partners to modernize its industry and introduce new technology. Foreign investments have become a significant advantage for the Kyrgyz economy. Recently, it has enacted a number of laws that protect investors’ rights. The most popular sectors for investments are natural resources, water and educational and cultural programs. Livestock has also attracted much attention recently. The quality of local meat is good, so it also has good chances for export. 

Suyun A., 51, is a butcher in a local meat pavilion in the town of Tokmok in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. It’s been fifteen years since she made her first steps into the business, following the advice of her relatives. Suyun is married and has three grown children. Her husband contributes to the family budget by working as a private cab driver. He also manages to find the time and strength to help in the meat business.

Suyun hopes for this loan to be a success, because she’s planning to invest some funds in broadening her business and the assortment of meat for sale. The family plans to open its own small pavilion and save some capital to arrange a nice wedding for their son.

Kuluira J., 52, is also a resident of Tokmok. She is married and sells vegetables in a local market. The purpose of her loan is to purchase goods to diversify the assortment of products she sells. 

Nurjamal M., 47, is a butcher in a food market of Tokmok.  Her husband helps her out too. Nurjamal applied for this loan in order to be able to rent additional space for selling meat.

Kumush T., 34, has followed her mother’s steps in meat selling. She is married and applied for this loan to increase the assortment of goods she sells.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously).

MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

texts.en:
Mariam K. is in her late thirties. She is married with one son, who is in school. She runs a business as a food vendor, and is also running a business selling second-hand clothes. She works from 6 am to 7 pm. She buys her clothes from the Kariakoo market in Dar es Salaam and sells them in Morogoro, a town about four hours' drive southwest of Dar es Salaam.

This will be Mariam's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her first loans, which she successfully repaid, to increase her food business and begin her clothing business. She wishes to use the current loan to buy more clothes, as well as to keep some in the bank, because her husband is sick. 

Mariam will share this loan with the other members of Wana wa Ngurumo Group, sixteen in total. The members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan. In the photo, Mariam can be seen on the far left in the first row.

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in Chichawatni which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agricultural industry. Her house consists of two rooms where she has been living since her birth. She is 48 years old, unmarried, and lives with her parents. She is a school teacher and also operates a cloth selling business. She imports cloth from the city of Multan and sells it to people in her community and in cloth shops. She helps support her family financially from her earnings. 

Nasreen has a brother who is involved in an animal sales business. He  deals  specifically with goats which he buys from the animal market. He buys young goats, raises them, and sells them to his customers at a profit. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother’s business. With the loan, he will buy young goats that will help improve his sales and his profit as well. 

He has been in this business for over 10 years, and Nasreen is hopeful that through this investment, her brother’s business will grow further and his income will increase. She is a new loan applicant at Asasah. She hopes it will be a good and profitable experience for her brother. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

She shares the financial burden with her husband by selling cloth. She buys cloth from different cloth shops and sells it to the clientele from her nearby area and earns an income.  She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. She is hopeful that this new business will bring good income to her husband.

Adelanta C. is from the village of Research Minante, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 58 years old. Adelanta is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Adelanta owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products on a school campus.She is also a part-time day care worker in their village. Adelanta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Adelanta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelanta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Adelanta is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Adelanta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida comes from Chichawatni which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and famous for its agricultural industry. She lives there in a 4-room house in a combined family system. She moved here after her marriage a few years ago. 

She is a housewife and stays at home doing her household chores. She is a very caring mother who is raising her children very well. She has proved herself as a responsible wife who is always ready to support her husband in every difficult time. She is a mother of three children, a daughter and two sons. Her sons are enrolled in school while her daughter is still very young and has not started to go to school. 

Her husband’s name is M. N. and he operates a grocery shop in the market. Her brother-in-law also lives with her family and he runs a motorbike showroom. 

Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery business. Her husband will invest the loan in purchasing grocery items according to his customers' needs and increase his sales. Shahida is hopeful that through this loan investment her husband’s business will grow and her family’s living standard improve. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is widowed. She sells men’s shoes in Melitopol town. She started this business 17 years ago. Her husband died five years ago in a car accident. Since then Nataliya had to run their family business by herself. 

Nataliya was able to develop her business well and make it a stable source of income for her family. Today Nataliya rents a small store offering good quality shoes and  excellent customer service. Nataliya has opened a second location recently. 

Nataliya is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to increase the assortment of shoes at the second location. Nataliya lives with her son and helps him pay for his college.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of shoes she has to sell

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian T., from the Obunga area, is 35 years old and married to Stephen; they have five children aged between 19 years and 5 years old.

Lillian has operated a firewood-selling business for the past 10 years, her large clientele consisting mainly of the area hotels and the people in her village who use the wood for cooking. She is applying for her second loan and intends to buy more firewood to sell to her customers.

Lillian desires to diversify into selling second hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy firewood to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional wood

loans.name: Temuujin

texts.en:
Temuujin, 30, lives with his wife, four-year-old daughter, and his elder sister in her two bedroom studio apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His parents looks after his daughter.

For two years Temuujin and his wife have run a popcorn-making business, selling their products through some supermarkets and grocery stores. Having gained valuable experience, in the future he plans to expand his business by improving the production line and equipment. Temuujin is now requesting a loan to purchase a car to deliver his products.

loans.use: To buy car for delivery of his products

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Lebanese Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents. While his father is the main income provider of the family, the borrower helps him with the heavy family expenses.

Despite his young age, he has owned a curtain shop for five years. With his loan request of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to increase his store’s inventory and offer new curtain designs to his customers. He looks forward to further expanding his business, stating that every year has been better than the year before. He is planning to open a small curtain factory and begin working with some galleries to present his products.

loans.use: To increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Vincent Makokha

texts.en:
Vincent O., 39 years old and married to Nancy Okema, is the father of three children aged 15, 10 and 6 years. They live in Khwisero in Kakamega.

Vincent has a transport business, using a motorcycle to transport people and goods to and from town to their respective homes. He has been in this business for the past year and is now applying for his first loan from KADET LTD. to purchase motorcycle spare parts for his motorbike.

His desire is to open up a motorcycle spare parts shop and sell to all the other motorbike operators in the town.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Zyinakan's Group

texts.en:
Throughout Kyrgyz history there have been legends about the strength and patience of Kyrgyz women. The southern queen, Kurmanjan Datka, who joined Kyrgyz to the Russian Empire; a legendary ballet dancer, Bubusara Beishenalieva; and our acting president, Rosa Otumbaeva, are just a few of the hundreds of examples of how Kyrgyz women always cherish the land and traditions. These following stories are great tales of Kyrgyz women reaching out for their dreams.

Zyinakan M., 70, is a leader of this group and a resident of Tokmok. She is a widow; her children live in Bishkek. She works both in livestock raising and in a small business of sewing national handmade souvenirs. Being a very experienced woman in cattle raising, she was brave enough to start another business by herself at age of 69. She had already provided her children with a good education and had bought a house. She hopes to save some money for arranging a wedding for her son and becoming a grandmother. The main purpose of the loan is to buy sheep for diversifying her livestock business.

Abdimakhamad M., 21, is a resident of Tokmok. He has been involved in construction of apartments and houses for two years. The purpose of the loan is to buy construction materials and equipment for finishing up his house.
