Elvira D., 27, is a baker in Tokmok. Her dream is to open a chain of her own bakeries throughout the whole country. She hopes this loan will help her to make this dream come true. She will spend her profits on purchasing furniture.

Marina D., 30, works as a packager in a bakery. The purpose of the loan is to buy winter clothes and furniture for her kitchen.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Jackson Odenyo

texts.en:
Jackson Odenyo L. is 47 years old and married to Pamela Anyango Onyango. They have four school going   children aged 18, 16, 13, and 8 years old.  Their place of residence is in Eldoret-Kenya. He operates a green grocery and has been in this business for 13 years and earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES.

Jackson learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer and so he is applying for his first loan of 25,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase avocado, oranges, lemon, watermellon and pilipilihoho. He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand the grocery and have wholesale stall.

In future Jackson's deeper desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To purchase avocado, oranges, lemon, watermellon, pilipilihoho.

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en:
Zamira U. is 40, married. She is the leader of the group. Currently she has to raise 2 children by herself because her husband is working in Russia. Both of children are school pupils. Zamira supports her family financially by selling fruits and vegetables wholesale.  On the side she also sells household goods. With her profits, she has managed to increase the assortment and also start a poultry breeding business. In order to make house repairs, the family needs to get a loan. In future they are planning to arrange daughter’s marriage, then to build the kitchen. 

Zamira’s partners:

Ulugbek N. is 20 years old and is not married. He earns a living by working as a taxi-driver.  On the side he earns income from cattle breeding. The purpose of the loan is to purchase livestock animals for fattening and breeding. 

Gavharoi S. is 39 years old and is married. Her family has 3 children. The family is engaged in cultivating sunflowers and corn. On the side, the head of the family earns a living by reselling fruits and vegetables wholesale. The purpose of the loan is to purchase potato seeds. 

Ihvalai R. is 41 and married. She is the treasurer of the group. Together with her husband, they are raising a daughter. The family earns money by harvesting carrot, turnip and cotton. The purpose of the loan is to purchase potato seeds and prepare the ground for sowing. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to repair the house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old single man living with his brothers and sisters. He is from Lebanon. This talented borrower has been working as a homebuilder since 2005. And he has been involved in this occupation for the past 10 years when he was very young. He takes part in the family expenses with his brothers. With his loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will invest in purchasing a construction crane to develop his business level. In the future, he is looking to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase a construction crane

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en: Jenifa M.  is currently in the business of selling fish, green vegetables and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to stock more fish and Jerry cans of cooking oil to sell.  Jenifa is 39 years old and is married with a husband that is a farmer . She has 3 children and only one child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more fish and jerry cans of cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en: Lilias Y. is currently in the business of selling fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. Lilias is 40 years old. She is married and her husband is a businessman. She has 4 children and 2 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila O. is the leader of this group. She is 56 years old and she is married. Her husband is engaged in farming in spite of his being a pensioner (his pension is about 3300 soms per month). The couple has raised a son, 34, who earns money by selling timber. 

Jamila runs her own business which involves sewing national clothes. This businesslike woman has a mini-workshop with necessary equipment. Out of total profits, the family has managed to open a small grocery shop. In order to purchase a sewing-machine and supplies for making her national clothing, Jamila hopes to get a loan. In the future she is planning to sell all her working data.

Jamila’s partners:

Karybek T., 63, is married. He has a son. Karybek and his wife raise money by cultivating and selling crops. During 10 years of working hard, the family has managed to increase cattle stock. The loan purpose is to purchase wheat and chemical fertilizers. 

Rahimberdi M., 52, is married. His family has 4 children. The family makes their income by cattle breeding; currently they are keeping 6 cows and 8 other livestock animals. The loan purpose is to purchase 3 livestock animals for increasing the total number of stock.

Gulnar C. is the treasurer of the group. She is 52 and widowed. Being alone, she has to bring up 4 children. The family makes money by cattle breeding and selling dairy products. In order to increase cattle stock, Gulnar intends to obtain a calf. For this purpose, she needs to get a loan. 
	
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing-machine.

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Bayarmagnai N. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and 17 year old daughter in Bayanhoshuu of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her wife is disabled (blind) but still helps with his business. 

Bayarmagnai owns and operates his own shoe repair business. He began his business in a rented place in 1994. He has, since then, saved enough money to build his own workspace where he operates his shoe repair business. Over the many years of operation, he has built a stable business and has gained much experience. For the future, he hopes to expand his business by selling second hand shoes through his repair shop. Bayarmagnai is a very clever and hardworking man and says, " I want to enlarge and decorate my work place".  He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan in order to buy a shoe sewing machine for his repair shop.

loans.use: To buy a shoe sewing machine.

loans.name: Nargiza's Group

texts.en:
Nargiza S. is the leader of the group. She is 31, married. Together with her husband, who makes his livelihood by working as a private builder, grows up 3 children, all of them are school pupils. The main source of family incoming gets out of trading: the family sells fruits and vegetables by retail. This business has been started 19 years ago after allotment. Out of profits they have managed to build a house and to obtain a milk cow. Further plans include obtaining cattle for further fattening and breeding, for this purpose the family hopes to get a loan. In future they want to finish house building, then to give children proper education and to develop the business.

Nargiza’s partners:

Gulumkan T. is the treasurer of the group. She is 31 and married. Her family has 3 daughters. The family currently cultivates corn and cotton-plants. This year, the ground is being prepared for sowing wheat. The loan purpose is to obtain the necessary equipment for ploughing and fertilizing the ground. 

Abduvohop M., 42, is married. His family has 4 children. The family is engaged in trading. They retail in food items and also breed cattle. The loan purpose is to increase the cattle stock and to enlarge the retail goods assortment. 

Ainura I., 23, is married. She and her husband have a daughter. The family is engaged in farming clover, corn and cotton. The loan purpose is to purchase a TV set. 

 	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Davaadolgor

texts.en:
Davaadolgor S. is 51 years old and lives with her husband. three children and two grandchildren in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her oldest daughter works for the newspaper and the other two children operate private businesses. Her two granddaughters attend a local kindergarten. 

Davaadolgor and her husband operate a shoe repair service in the local market. She started her own business in 1996 after working at a company as a shoemaker between 1993 and 1996. She also produces traditional Mongolian shoes (Buriad shoes) that are just right for the cold Mongolian winter. Her business is usually very busy during winter months. She says, "I try to be a responsible client to the bank. I want to be a trustworthy customer who always pays the loan principle and interest rate on time." 

She is requesting a 500,000 MNT  loan to purchase more materials and supplies in order to produce and sell more shoes for the upcoming winter when the demand for such products rise.

loans.use: To purchase more materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jena

texts.en: Jena E. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and simsim and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  Jena is 40 years old and is widowed.   She has 3 children and only 1 child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Dechmaa

texts.en: Dechmaa D. is a 61-year-old single mother with four children. Three of her children live on their own. She and her daughter and granddaughter live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter works as a teacher in the school and her granddaughter attends a secondary school. Dechmaa operates a dairy products business in the local community. She started her business in 1996 operating a small shop where she sold a variety of foodstuffs and dairy products. After she closed her shop, she decorated an extra room of apartment where she started to operate her dairy trading business. Over the years, she has built a stable operation and has made much progress with her business. Dechmaa says, "All I want is to provide good education for my grandchild." Her daughter purchased a grocery store and she will open a stall to sell her dairy products in order to increase her working capital. That is why she is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To buy more dairy products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O.  is currently in the business of selling onions, beans, tomatoes, fish etc and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and onions to sell.  Mary is 28 years old and is married with a husband that is a carpenter. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Signife

texts.en:
Signife D. is from the village of Research Minante 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Signife is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Signife owns & operates a general store selling food products in the local community. Signife has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Signife joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Signife has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Signife is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Signife from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en: Ganbat M. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. He and his family all live together in their ger (Mongolian nomadic housing tent). His two children both attend secondary school and his wife works as a doctor in the local hospital. Ganbat owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town. He began his business in 2000 by operating a transportation business using his tricycle and has since upgraded his vehicle to a car. After years of experience he has gained a lot of business experience. He would like to trade his current car for a bigger automobile. Ganbat is a very helpful and hardworking man. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a new engine for his car.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for his car.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man living with his parents and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a car repair shop for almost 10 years. He specializes in auto body repair. He shares in the family expenses with his father. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household expenses, sick and aging family members, and at the same time run a business. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. He will invest in improving his business and purchase new tools. In the future, he is looking to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year. He is planning to open a car spare parts shop to supplement his business in the coming year.

loans.use: To invest in improving his business and purchase new tools needed

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice S. is 29 years old, married with a husband who is a doctor. They have 2 small children. Alice is currently in the business of sewing clothes using a sewing machine and is requesting a loan to buy material to make more clothes to sew and sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by designing bedsheets to sell.

loans.use: To buy material to make more clothes to sew and sell.

loans.name: Mondulu

texts.en: Mondulu L. is 24 years old, married with a husband who is a soldier. They have 4 children who go to school. Mondulu is currently in the business of selling beans, onions, fish, maize flour and simsim (sesame) at the road side.  She is requesting a loan to stock more maize flour, beans and simsim to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Mondulu hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more maize flour, beans and simsim to sell

loans.name: Haethon's Group

texts.en:
Haethon R. is the leader of the group that carries her name. She is 41, married and has 2 children. Both of them attend school. The family produces income in different ways: the head of the family works at a mill and with the help of all family members runs a cattle breeding business. Haethon raises money by sewing national wares. Out of total earnings they have managed to make house repairs and also to arrange a daughter’s marriage. In order to increase cattle stock, the family is planning to purchase calves. They hope to get a loan for this purpose. In future their plans include developing the business and then bath-house building.

Haethon’s partners:

Manzurahon K., 49, married.  Her family has 3 children. Manzurahon earns her living by working as a nurse in the local hospital. In addition, her daughter supports the family financially by sewing women's clothes. The loan purpose is to purchase material for sewing clothes and curtains. 

Bakiyahon A., 49, married. Her family has 6 children. The family makes their living by growing cotton. In addition they breed cattle. The loan purpose is to purchase fodder for animals.  

Zuhrahon H. is the treasurer of the group. She is 52, married. The family is starting their own business. They just opened a shop and in order to purchase goods they need to get a loan. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Debora

texts.en: Debora M. is 30 years old, married with a husband who is a teacher. They have one child who is too young to go to school. Debora is currently in the restaurant business and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs in her restaurant. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to enlarge her restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs in her restaurant

loans.name: Suluu's Group

texts.en:
Suluu J., the leader of the group, is 47 and married. She and her husband, who raises money by working as a private builder (his salary comes to 5000 soms per month), have two children, a daughter who is a student of the university in the city of Osh, and a son who works in Russia. Suluu and her daughter sell milk (10 liters daily ) and eggs. The loan's purpose is to allow them to complete the building of their house. In the future the family plans to arrange the children’s weddings and then develop a cattle-breeding business,

Suluu’s partners:

Erkingul A., the treasurer of the group, is 51, married, and the mother of four grown children. The family's main income derives from selling milk and eggs. The loan's purpose is to purchase poultry and cattle for fattening and breeding.

Maksudahan M., 47, is a widowed mother of three children. The family sells milk, and the loan's purpose is to purchase a cow for fattening and breeding.

Kanaatbek A., 35, is a married father of three small sons. Kanaatbek supports his family financially by cattle breeding and cattle sales. He also sells automobiles. The loan's purpose is to purchase cattle and fodder.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To finish building a house

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma D. C., age 40, provides manicure and pedicure services in her local community in the village of Research Minante 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. Wilma and her husband have six school-aged children. 
 
In 2007, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide services. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase necessary materials. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Wilma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide manicure and pedicure services

loans.name: Muslima

texts.ru: Шарипова Муслима проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 42 года. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке "Тиджорат". Арендует торговую точку, где продает одежду и обувь. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Она намерена привести сезонные товары.
texts.en: Muslima Shapirova lives in the Yavan district.  She is 42 years old, a widow and has 2 children.  She has a secondary education.  Muslima has been involved in retail sales at the "Tidjorat" market.  She leases a retail outlet, where she sells clothing and shoes.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.  Muslima intends to bring in seasonal mechandise.

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a mother of two daughters and three sons. Fatima lives in Jenin. Fatima's sons are working and are responsible for household expenses. Abd Arrahman, Fatima's son, is a Palestinian National Authority employee. He used to work in a barber shop when he was in school. Fatima wants to help her son have a barber shop and increase his income.

Fatima came to FATEN and took a loan to purchase needed tools to equip a barber shop, as her son rented a shop for this purpose. Fatima helped her son because he is known as a good barber and the shop will increase his income.

Abd Arrahman appears in the picture above in FATEN's office because Fatima is very religious and would not have her picture published.

loans.use: To prepare and equip a barber shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K.  is currently in the business of selling sugar, soda, etc. in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock cartons of salt, boxes of soap, etc. to sell.  

Grace is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is an NGO staff.  She has 5 children, and 4 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock salt, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase coral blocks, cement, timber, nails, and iron sheets for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a door to door cloth selling business. Her customers are the neighboring community and passersby. Lucy faces a major challenge of high transport costs incurred when moving from door to door. She hopes to be self reliant in the future. 

With the 30,000 KSH loan, she wants to purchase bedsheets, curtains and utensils for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bedsheets, curtains and utensils for resale.

loans.name: Linda Atieno

texts.en:
Linda Atieno O. has been in the salon business and at the same time sells cosmetics [beauty products] to her customers, who have much confidence in her work. The business has lasted for four years and she earns a profit margin of 7,000 Kshs per month. The business location is at Huruma estate in the Nairobi capital city.  Most of her customers live in the area.

She learned about KADET LTD through a friend and she is applying for her first loan of 15,000 KSH to purchase more beauty products worth 10,000 KSH and a hair dryer worth 5,000 KSH.  The anticipated profit will be used to open another outlet in the surrounding area.

Linda hopes to grow her business and run more stable salons and to sell better beauty products in Huruma. She is a single woman who was separated from her husband and she is 30 years old.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products and buy a hair dryer.

loans.name: Ganhuu

texts.en:
Ganhuu A., age 44, operates an imported clothing items trading business out of a stall in a trade center. She began her business in 2000 after working as a cook in the small cafe. With the loan from XacBank, she was able to build a house for her family. She is a modest and honest woman who is dedicated to repaying her loan on time. She is requesting a 200,000 MNT in order to import a large amount of winter clothing items from China to offer for sale. 	

Ganhuu lives with her husband and four children in the Harhorin, the ancient capital city of Mongolian empire. She and her family live together in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son currently lives and studies at university in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The other three children all attend a local secondary school. Her husband owns about 80 livestock and works as a herder in the countryside surrounding their town.

loans.use: To import a large amount of winter clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Oyungerel D., age 56, operates a meat retail trading business in her town. She started her business in 2000 with a working capital of 300,000 MNT. After many years of operation, she has gained significant experience as a trader. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to invest in her business as well as to purchase an LCD TV and a washing machine for her home.

She lives with her son in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. They live in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son works as the assistant driver of a micro bus and transports people between Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and Bulgan province. Oyungerel hopes one day to help her son buy his own micro bus.

loans.use: To invest in her business as well as to purchase an LCD TV and a washing machine for her home

loans.name: Selenge

texts.en:
Selenge L. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger - a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent - in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter attends a secondary school. 

Since 2008 Selenge has been operating a underwear, hat and scarf retail business from a stall at Narantuul market, the largest and most important market in the city. Her stall is located near to the main door of the market, which is a very popular and crowded area. She sells a variety of underwear, hats and scarves and her wide selection of products attracts many customers. She imports her products from China once or twice a month. After years of operating this business her earnings have enabled her to start building a house in her yard for her family. 

Selenge is a very open-minded and sociable woman and is well known by her customers. About the future she says, "I would like to start another stall from my business profits in the future." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to import winter clothing items from Erlian, a border city of China, for her business.

loans.use: To import items of winter clothing

loans.name: Tsogzolmaa

texts.en:
Tsogzolmaa E. is 23 years old and lives with her husband and two-year-old daughter in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Tsogzolmaa operates a grocery store next to her home. She began her business by renting a grocery shop. Since then she has been able to build a small house in which she sells a variety of food products. She hopes to continue to grow her shop and to improve her family's standard of living. In the future she hopes to establish her own big supermarket. She is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of groceries to sell and to resolve heating problems in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of groceries for her store

loans.name: Uurtsaih

texts.en:
Uurtsaih J. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Harhorin, the capital city of the ancient Mongolian empire. Her two sons attend a local secondary school. She lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. 

Uurtsaih currently operates a meat and dairy product trading business. She purchases meat, animal products and dairy products in bulk from herders in the countryside and transports it to Ulaanbaatar, the largest city in Mongolia and its capital, where she sells the produce. She started her meat trading business in 2008, selling out of a rented stall at the market in her town. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase livestock and dairy products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and dairy products

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Peter. He is married and has one child aged ten. He has two additional dependents living with him - his mother-in-law and an adopted child. 

In 2007 Peter established his provisions business. He began this business because he wanted to be self-reliant. Peter would like a loan for the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Peter has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional provisions. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 274,800. In the future Peter plans to open a bigger shop, build a house and educate his child to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy provisions for store

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enhtsetseg S. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her son and daughter both attend university and her husband is disabled. They all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent.

Enhtsetseg operates a grocery trading business in the local market. She started her grocery trading business in 1997 and has built a stable operation. She purchases a large amount of vegetables at wholesale prices and sells at the grocery market as a retailer. 

After years of successful operation her business earnings have enabled her, not only to provide for her family, but also to pay her children's tuition fees. She is a hardworking and modest woman. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital of grocery business

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan G. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. 

He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife helps to sell wood products at the local market when he produces them. 

Batsaihan operates a transport service in his town. He started his transportation business in 2005, after operating a wood products making business in his home between 1994 and 2005.  With his business profits, he hopes to provide for his family and start building a garage for his truck. 

Batsaihan is a very modest, open-minded, and hard-working person. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to improve his truck.

loans.use: To improve truck for transportation business

loans.name: Zareife

texts.en:
Zareife is a young woman from Jabalia Refugee Camp. She is married and a mother of three daughters and two sons. Her husband Kamal owns a small sheep farm on which he raises sheep for sale.

Zareife came to FATEN and took a loan because her husband needs to increase the number of sheep he raises since Al Adha feast is around the corner and demand is increasing.  Zarefei's husband will use the loan for this purpose which will increase their income and improve the family's situation.

Zarefie's husband Kamal appears in the picture here as Zareife, like all Gazans, is very religious and is not comfortable having her picture online.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase sheep for sale

loans.name: Azim

texts.ru: Латыпов Азим житель города Душанбе. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Азим имеет высшее образование. По профессии проработал два года. Сейчас он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения машины. Он продал свою старую машину и хочет купить новую.
texts.en: Azim L. lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 26 years old, married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Azim has a higher education.  He worked in his field for two years.  Currently, he provides a taxi service.  He has been in this business for 5 years.  Azim is requesting this loan for the purchase of a car.  He sold his old car and wants to buy a new one.

loans.use: Purchase of a car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pineapple suckers or slips for planting.

loans.name: Darou Salam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 28 mars 2008. Il est composé de 08 femmes qui sont toutes issues de la même concession. Elles sont pratiquement toutes de cousines ou des belles sœurs. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD2.

Madame Boye N. debout à droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 4 enfants.

Elle fait un petit commerce qui consiste la vente jus de fruit naturel, de pain et de lait caillé. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter beaucoup plus de provision pour augmenter ses revenus financiers

Son objectif est de renforcer ses épargnes et prendre en charge sa progéniture.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on March 28, 2008. It is composed of eight women who are all from the same area. Most of them are cousins or sisters-in-law to other group members. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Montagne Nord2.

Ms Boye N. (pictured standing at the right side) chairs the group. She is 56 years old, widowed and the mother of four children. She has a small business in which she sells natural fruit juice, bread and curds. She will use her new loan to buy much more inventory to increase her income. Her objective is to boost her savings and provide for her descendants.

loans.use: To bolster her income generating activity

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: This is 35 year-old Emmanuel.  He is married, and has 2 children aged 9 and 3. He has 4 additional dependents, who live with him because he educates them.  In 2006, Emmanuel established his medical drugs business. He began his business because he wanted to be self reliant.  Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,010,000 every month from this business.  He serves the entire Tokpoi town and has over twenty customers per day because of his encouraging words and strong business skills.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Emmanuel now requires a new loan in order to buy paracetamol, ampiclox, and ampicillin and ibunol capsules. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 201,000. In the future, Emmanuel plans to expand his shop and to open another outlet and would love to build a house for his children.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is use to buy medical drugs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy provisions.

loans.name: Tolibchon

texts.ru: Сатторов Толибчон проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Более 4 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Tolibchon S. lives in the Varzob district.  He is 25 years old, married and has 2 children.  He has a secondary education.  Tolibchon has been involved in animal husbandry for over 4 years.  He breeds livestock for future resale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock, in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Khaki Association-Jinja Group

texts.en: K. Aisha belongs to Khaki Association-Jinja. The 34 year old has been managing her tailoring business located along the road for the last 13 years. It is a business she began with loads of confidence, after she had acquired tailoring skills at the Elidima factory, a leading garment factory in Jinja. In a week, this mother of 4, who is happily married, says she makes 20,000 shillings.  With this loan she is going to purchase more cloth to make fabrics.

loans.use: The purchase of more cloth for making fabrics.

loans.name: Sop Sa Jëkër Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SA JËKËR est créé le 28 mars 2008. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui nouent des liens de parenté. Leur activité principal est petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD2

Madame Fatou D., debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 22 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge.

Elle fait un petit commerce de produits divers. Tels des enfants et tissus et ustensile de cuisine

Avec son financement elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement pour accroitre ses bénéfices

Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
The SOP SA JËKËR solidarity group was created March 28, 2008. It is composed of nine women with ties of kinship. As their main activity, they run small businesses. The group is part of the Banc Villageois MONTAGNE NORD2.

Mrs. Fatou D., standing on the right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 22 years old, married, and the mother of two children in her care. She sells various items such as fabrics and kitchen utensils. 

With her loan, she plans to increase her stocks of merchandise and bolster her profits. Her goal is to boost her savings and help take care of the family.

loans.use: To develop and promote her small business

loans.name: Mahmadrachab

texts.ru: Алиев Махмадрачаб проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование высшее, экономист. По профессии не работает. Уже 4 года как занимается животноводством и продажей мяса. Он в основном разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Mahmadrachab A. lives in the Varzob district.  He is 25 years old, married and has 2 children.  He has a higher education, as an economist; however, he does not work in that field.  Mahmadrachab has been involved in animal husbandry and meat sales for 4 years.  He primarily breeds livestock at home.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice K. is currently in the business of selling beans, simsim, bread and fish by the side of the road and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of simsim and beans to sell. Joice is 30 years old and is married, with a husband who is a soldier. She has one child, who does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of simsim and beans to sell.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda S. is a widow who lives with her two sons in Yerevan. Seda’s daughter is married and has her own family, but she helps her mother in her business of trading bedclothes. Seda has been running her business for about eight years. She purchases merchandise from Turkey twice a month, and when Seda is away making purchases, her daughter take her place at the stall.

Thanks to her income, Seda supports her family and pays for her sons’ educations. Her sons will become economists in the near future, which was a dream Seda and her late husband shared during their life together.

Seda is seeking a $2500 loan to buy more bedclothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more bedclothes to resell.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en: Lili P. is currently in the business of selling clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more pairs of trousers and dresses to sell. Lili is 25 years old and married, with a husband who is a businessman. She has two children, of whom only one goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more pairs of trousers and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva B. lives in Yerevan with her husband, a son, a daughter-in-law, and a grandchild. 

For about 7 years Silva has been engaged in trading women's clothing.  On weekdays she trades clothes in a rented place in “Surmalu” market, and on weekends at night she runs her business in “Hrazdan” market (where villagers come for wholesale purchases to resell).  

At her stalls she sells tracksuits, dressing gowns, and house suits, which she purchases from Syria and Turkey twice a month.  

Silva's husband helps her a lot at her business, and they support their family and their son's young family, because Silva's son is a singer and he doesn't earn a lot of money yet.    

Silva intends to use part of her business profit to purchase merchandise from China in the future, as it is more profitable (Silva says in China clothes are cheaper than in Syria and Turkey).

Silva is asking for a $2,500 loan to buy a new assortment for her business: blouses, sweaters, etc.

loans.use: To buy blouses and sweaters for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K.  is currently in the business of selling maize, beans and simsim (sesame) at the market  and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice to sell.  Mary is 40 years old and married to a laborer. She has 3 children who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, Mary hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: to stock bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice K. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of charcoal to sell. Alice is 38 years old and married to a carpenter. She has 4 children who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maziima Association-Jinja Group

texts.en: K. Hassani, 30 years old,  belongs to Maziima Association-Jinja. He has been operating his food sales business in Namulesa for 8 years. His clients have mostly been people in the local community. His weekly profits add up to 70,000 UGX. Prior to this business, he was into farming. With this loan, he plans to purchase about 20 litres of cooking oil, salt and charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, salt and charcoal

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice T.  is currently in the business of selling fish, tomatoes and beans and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. Joice is 27 years old and married to a businessman. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Aputu

texts.en: Aputu R.  is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell. Aputu is 30 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has 1 child who is currently in school.  Aisha has been running a salon for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Aisha hopes to own a cosmetic shop.        

Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by empowering her business.

loans.use: To purchase braids.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en: 53 year old M. Willy operates his personal products sales business in Jinja central market. He has been running this business for 11 years now and weekly his profit returns add up to shillings 100,000. Willy is married with 4 kids. He also operates a farming business. It is savings from this business that helped him start up. With this loan he says he is going to rejuvenate his business.

loans.use: The rejuvenation of his business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty D. is currently in the business of selling cassava and groundnuts.  She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnut and cassava for sale.  Betty is 28 years old and is widowed.   She has 3 children, 2 of which go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of groundnut and cassava to sell

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
K. Annet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is married and has no children. Annet has been running a retail shop for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar, soap for sale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Annet hopes to own a wholesale shop.  Annet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to play netball.

loans.use: purchase sugar, soap for sale.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy Namabiro is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Cissy has had a pharmacy business for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 250,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicine. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Cissy hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Cissy hopes to own a medical home. Cissy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning job skills.

loans.use: to buy more medicine.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. Dinah owns and operates a salon, which she has had for three years.

To help expand her business, Dinah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Dinah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Dinah hopes to own a plot. Dinah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her confidence and job skills.

loans.use: To purchase braids.

loans.name: Santuke

texts.en: Santuke K. is currently in the business of selling sugar, cooking oil, fish, etc. and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of goods to sell. Santuke is 35 years old and married to a community leader. She has 2 children who do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of goods to sell

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children who are currently in school. Aisha has had a business selling food for 4 years.         

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Aisha hopes to own a plot of land. Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching members how to work together and encourage each other when one has lost hope.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Ruth has a poultry business which she has had for less than a year.  She does outside catering  

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more chicken.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Ruth hopes to own a plot of land. Ruth is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her job skills.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase more chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Shakirah

texts.en:
Shakirah N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Shakirah has a business of selling cold drinks, which she has had for 5 years.  She does outside catering  

To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more drinks, cooking oil and banking flour.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Shakirah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Shakirah hopes to build a house for her mother. Shakirah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving on her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, cooking oil and baking flour.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is married and has no children.  Maimuna has a business of a retail shop for electrical items, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Maimuna has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase supplies electrical materials.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Maimuna hopes to generate greater profits and take care for herself.  In the future, Maimuna hopes to own a plot of land.  Maimuna is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving more on her business.

loans.use: To buy electrical material supplies

loans.name: Mercy Akinyi

texts.en:
Mercy O. is 22 years old and married to Alfred Odhiambo. They have two children, Eugene is four years old and in baby class and Chrissy who is three months old. They live in Oruba area in Migori.

Mercy is a tailor and has been doing this business for the past three years. She is known for making nice African clothes and has thus created a large clientele. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client of KADET. Mercy will use the money to buy materials to add to her stock so that she can meet the demands of her clients during the festive season. Her monthly income comes to Kshs 8,000.

Her desire is to expand her business and open  a big wholesale shop for her materials in Migori town.

loans.use: Buy supplies of materials to add to her inventory

loans.name: Bester

texts.en: Bester N.  is currently in the business of selling coffee, cow peas, fish, beans, groundnuts etc  and is requesting a loan to stock more supplies of goods to sell.  Bester is 45 years old and is married. Her husband is a head teacher. She has 11 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more supplies of  goods to sell

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
N. Rehema is 49 years old and a mother of five. It is five years since she began her food sales business along the Iganga Road, Jinja. She has mostly been selling staples like cassava, maize, millet and beans.

Her profits total up to 200,000 shillings per month. She says she began this business with the assistance of her husband. With this loan, she says, she is going to buy more of the above crops for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of cassava, maize, millet and beans for resale

loans.name: Torufania

texts.en: Torufania S.  currently sells groundnuts and cassava.  She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnuts to sell.  Torufania is 40 years old and is a widow.   She has 4 children, who all attend school.  With the extra profits resulting from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose J. currently sells mandasi, (a doughnut-like bread), sugar, rice and other goods.  She is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour, bags of sugar and other goods to sell.  Rose is 40 years old and married.  Her husband is a farmer. She has 6 children;  3 of them go to school.  With the extra profits resulting from her loan, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more baking flour and other goods

loans.name: Mweni

texts.en:
Mweni B. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, who are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members.    Mweni sells handbags and African attire.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and she works 6 days a week, selling clothing door-to-door.   Mweni has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more handbags and rolls of African attire.  She aspires to add more African attire, such as Kitengi, to her product line.
Her main business challenge is transportation.

Mweni also generates additional income through rentals.  She lives in a home that she owns and she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and  feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more African attire and handbags

loans.name: Sabine

texts.en:
Sabine Y. is 38 years old  and a mother to two boys. She is married to Joseph Ojwang,  who repairs watches for a living.  They live in the town of  Migori.

Sabine has a greengrocery that she has been running for nine years. She sells bananas, vegetables, fish, eggs and other goods. She is applying for her fifth loan from Kadet Ltd, where she has established a good credit history. Sabine will use the money to buy more fish, vegetables and crates of eggs to add to her stock. The profits made will be used to support her family's needs.

Her desire is to educate her children up to the university level and to grow her business to great heights.

loans.use: To buy more fish, vegetables and other goods

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina U. sells food including daga (a type of fish), beans and mandasi (a doughnut-like bread).  She is requesting a loan to stock the same goods to sell.  Regina is 27 years old and is married.  Her husband is a watchman. She has 5 children;  3 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits resulting from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartoons of fish, dried meat, crab etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace Y.  is currently in the business of selling simsim, groundnuts and green vegetables and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnuts to sell.  Grace is 32 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business and pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Atakola Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en: Jamila W. is 40years old and a member of the Atakola women’s Group.  She has been running a restaurant business for the last 10 years. It is a business that has been generating 100,000 shillings per week as profits. Jamila is a married woman, with 6 kids. She says to begin in this business, she got financial assistance from her husband. Previously, she was a house wife. With this loan, she says she is going to buy materials such as cement, sand and iron sheets for building a family house and also to buy foods like maize flour, bananas and beans for her restaurant.

loans.use: The purchase of materials such as cement, sand, etc for building the family house

loans.name: Jose Octavio

texts.es:
José de 54 años, es vendedor informal en las calles de Guayaquil, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 25, 18, 13, 10 años en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar esta ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Empezó a trabajar como comerciante ambulante hace 20 años atrás para poder mantener a su familia ya que tiene cuatro hijos, recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil vendía artículos de temporada como cometas para niños, frutas heladas por unidad. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 15h00pm con ayuda de su hijo de 25 años vendiendo las cometas y las frutas.      

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de cometa para vender a un volumen mayor y materiales de construcción para su casa como cemento, bloques. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old.  He sells products informally on the streets of Guayaquil.  He lives with his wife and  children aged 25, 18, 13 and 10 in a peri-urban area with all basic services in la Perimetral de Guayaquil, an area surrounded by a salt marsh.

He began working as an itinerant salesman 20 years ago in order to support his family since he has four children.  He sold seasonal articles such as children's kites and individual frozen fruits in the streets of Guayaquil.  He currently works from 8.00am to 3.00pm with the help of his 25 year-old son selling kites and fruit.

He would like to use the loan to buy kite materials so that he can sell more of them and building materials for his house such as cement, blocks, etc.  In the future he would like to finish building his house.

loans.use: Materials for making kites, cement and blocks

loans.name: Iganga Road 2 Group-Jinja

texts.en: 54 year old N. Slyvia has been operating a retail business along the main street in Jinja for the past 4 years.  She is a widow with 4 kids who she says have all finished school courtesy of her hard work. She has been selling shoes, handbags and clothes etc. Her customer base consists of mostly the community members. She says to get established in this business, she used savings from her salary . She was working as a sales supervisor. In a week her business profits are to the tune of 150,000 shillings.  With this loan she says she is going to purchase more shoes, shirts, skirts and handbags for resell. Her group is called Iganga Road

loans.use: To purchase more pairs of shoes, clothes, handbags, etc, for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose C. is 33 years old and married to Laban Chebii, who also works and together they are blessed with four children.  Rose runs a second hand clothes store and a posho mill as her secondary business.  Rose has been in this business for five years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KSH.  She is borrowing a loan of 40,000 KSH which she will use as follows: 20,000 KSH to purchase maize stock and the remaining 20,000 KSH to purchase second hand clothes.  She is planning to use the anticipated profit to educate her children.  Rose is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully paying her previous loan.  Her hope and dream is to grow her business and buy a vehicle for transporting her goods to the market place for sale.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Mwinyi Group

texts.en:
Seleman R. is in his early-thirties and is married with one child who is four and a half years old. He owns a charcoal store and has a motorbike businesses.  He has been operating them for the past two years. He opens daily between 7 am and 4 pm and earns a good monthly profit. 

This will be Seleman's 8th loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start selling charcoal and started building his house and he has successfully paid back all of his loans. He hopes to get another loan to continue building his house. Seleman's dream is to one day complete and stay in his house.

Seleman will share this loan with his loan group Mwinyi, which totals 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Seleman is seen 3rd from right wearing a black heart.

loans.use: To finish building his house.

loans.name: Susan Auma

texts.en:
Susan Auma O. is a 50-year-old from Migori. She is married to Leonard and they have seven children who are all going to school.

Susan has a clothing business that she has been running for the past year. She has seen her business grow and is now applying for a loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy new clothes to add to her stock. 

She is currently selling the clothes in an open field but she hopes to attain a business structure as the business expands.  The profits made will cater to the family's basic needs.

Her desire is to one day be able to own a boutique shop and move from the field since it's really inconvenient, especially when it's too hot and during rainy seasons.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity W. is 38 years old and is a skilled and experienced business lady who sells cereals and groceries. She is married and together they have three children ages 12 and eight years old.

Purity started her business in 2003 with 5,000 KSH in start-up capital in Eldoret Town. She has been in this business for the past seven years with an income of 10,000 KSH per month.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit Officer and she is applying for her first loan of 15,000 KSH with KADET LTD and she plans to build a stall for her business.

loans.use: To build a stall for her business.

loans.name: Joel Kang'ali

texts.en:
Joel kang'ali A. is 31 years old and married to Jepkosgei Maureen, a business woman. Both Joel and his wife earn an income to support their family. They have two children, who are three years old and one year old. They live in Eldoret, Kenya. He operates a green grocery and has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly profit of 20,000 KES.

Joel learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer. He is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. With this loan, he intends to purchase bananas, avocados, oranges, lemons, watermelon, and pilipilihoho (hot peppers). He plans to use the profits to expand the grocery and buy more fruit.

In the future Joel hopes to own rental houses and offer a better education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase produce

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Doña Albertina, es una señora de 54 años de edad, dedicada a la venta de bebidas refrescantes, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, vive con una de sus hijas que tiene 17 años de edad y que tiene deficiencias siendo sorda y muda, ellas tienen casa propia. Este negocio lo administra desde hace 10 años siendo la vendedora mayorista de la zona, abasteciendo a las tiendas pequeñas del lugar, esta zona el clima es cálido por lo que la venta de bebida es una buena opción, ella solicita un préstamo para darle crecimiento al negocio y adquirir agua en bolsa, gaseosas, jugos en lata, esta compra la hará por mayor ósea por cajas, obteniendo mejores precio por ser mayorista.
Esta inversión le ayudara a contar con inventario para ofrecer a sus compradores minorista y aquellos negocios a los que abastece de mercadería. Su objetivo es tener un negocio rentable y  recibir más ingreso y lograr que su hija ingrese a una escuela especial para que aprenda a comunicarse.
texts.en: Albertina is a 54 year old lady who works selling soft drinks.  She lives in San Miguel in the department of San Miguel with one of her daughters who is 17 years old and a deaf mute.  They have their own home.  She has been running this business for 10 years and is the wholesale seller for her area, supplying small stores in the region.  This area's climate is hot which means that the sale of drinks is a good business option.  She is requesting this loan so that she can grow her business and acquire bags of water, soda and cans of juice.  She will buy them in quantity, in cases, obtaining them at better prices because she is a wholesaler.  This loan will help her to have a good inventory to offer her retail buyers and those businesses which she supplies with merchandise.  Her goal is to have a profitable business, make more income and manage to get her daughter enrolled in a special school so that she can learn to communicate.

loans.use: To buy drinks, juices, bottled water and soda

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata A. is 50 years old, from Ngiya and married to Barrack Ochieng. They have eight children, some are in college and some in high school.

Consolata has a cereal business that she has been running for the past six years.  She is applying for her second loan from Kadet Ltd after successfully repaying her first loan. 

She plans to use the loan to buy maize, millet, ground nuts, etc. to add to her stock.  Her monthly income is Kshs 15,000. The profits made from this business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to be able to improve the living standards of her family and see her business grow.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: David Amuyunzu

texts.en:
David Amuyunzu N. is 38 years old, married to Jemima Mungafu who is a business lady and is also a source of additional income for the family. 

They have three school-going children ages eight, six, and two.  He operates a retail shop in Eldoret Town, and has been in this business for five years, earning a monthly profit of Ksh.15,000.

David learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area.  He is applying for a third loan from KADET LTD  for Kshs 65,000, which he plans to use to buy six boxes of cooking oil, five bags of sugar, and any other stock that needed to be added.  He plans to expand his shop with the anticipated profits.  

In the future, David wishes to have a lorry to use for transportation. His deeper desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar, and other stock for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice Esi Amosiwah

texts.en: Beatrice Esi Amosiwah E. sells cooking utensils and shoes at Asenadze near Abura. She moves from one area to the other with the shoes. Beatrice has attained junior high level of education. She is single. She has been selling shoes for some time now. Her loan will enable her to buy more shoes to expand her business. She hopes to build a shop from her profit.

loans.use: buy more shoes to expand her business

loans.name: Mary Efua Mesima

texts.en: Mary Efua Mesima M. sells provisions and foodstuffs at Asenadze near Abura. Mary has been through junior high school. She is a single parent taking care of four children. She sees to the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She hopes to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: buy more foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
Don Carmelo Z. pequeño agricultor de la comarca El Banco del municipio de el Rama, es casado con la Sra. Justina Flores, tiene 4 hijos, Santos de 42 años, Abelardo de 40 y Francisca de 30, quienes ya se casaron y tienen su propia familia, unicamente habita con el el menor, Darvis de28 años quien le ayuda a trabajar la tierra y a cuidar la finca.  

Esta solicitando su 6to credito con el objetivo de comprar un semental que le permita mejorar la calidad de su ganado, y asi obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Cabe mencionar que anteriormente fue beneficiado con el fondo kiva, logrando establecer 3 mnz de arroz los cuales comercializo y obtuvo las ganancias que esperaba. 

Su mayor sueño es poder incrementar su inventario ganadero y dar mejores condiciones a sus hijos y esposa, pues son su razon de ser.
texts.en:
Mr. Carmelo Z., a small-time farmer in the El Banco region of the municipality of Rama, is married to Mrs. Justina Flores. They have four children: 42 year old Santos, 40 year old Abelardo, and 30 year old Francisca, who are already married and have families of their own. They still live with the youngest child, Darvis, who is 28 years old. He helps them to work the land and to care for the farm. 

He is asking for his 6th loan with the objective of buying a stud bull, which will allow him to better the quality of his cattle, and allow him to obtain better earnings, which in turn will allow him to better his family’s quality of life. It should be mentioned that he has previously been a beneficiary of Kiva funds. With those funds he succeeded in establishing 3 “manzanas” (land units of 7000 square meters each) of rice, which he has harvested and sold and obtained the earnings he was hoping for. 

His greatest dream is to be able to increase his livestock inventory and to provide his family with better living conditions, since they mean the world to him.

loans.use: To buy a stud bull

loans.name: Roberto Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto de 39 años de edad, es separado de su esposa,  tienen dos hijos que viven con su esposa pero el les apoyo con la educación y su alimentación, es doloroso cuenta el Sr. Roberto ya que no puede vivir con sus hijos pero trata de estar el mayor tiempo con ellos,  el  vive en Alquiler en el Barrio el recreo zona plan 3000, trabaja como chofer hace  ocho años.  El sr. Roberto  ahora es dueño de su propio microbús,  Al   Sr. Roberto se le refinancio el crédito para la reparación de su microbús (reparación de caja, muelles y  cremalleras en general, etc. ) . EL señor esta muy agradecido y sorprendido por la rapidez que se le otorgo el crédito y por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Roberto is 39 years old, separated from his wife, and has two children who live with his wife but whom he helps to feed and educate. Roberto says that it's painful for him not to live with his children, but he tries to spend as much time as he can with them. He lives in a rented home in the Plan 3000 neighborhood and has been working as a driver for the past 8 years. Roberto owns his own minibus, and is refinancing his previous loan in order to  repair his minibus (ignition, shocks, general repairs, etc.). Roberto is very grateful for the support provided to him and impressed by the speed with which he was given a loan.

loans.use: Minibus repairs

loans.name: Na We Cam Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Na We Cam” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Alaymatu K. is the leader of this group. The 28-year-old is married to a businessman and they have three children. Alaymatu has been a businesswoman for fifteen years now, she sells fried foods, bread, and stew. With her share of this loan, she will buy frying materials like a bag of flour, oil, sugar, baking powder, yeast, firewood, etc. in large quantity in order to produce more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: Buy frying materials like a bag of flour, oil, sugar, baking powder, yeast, firewood, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es: La Sra.
