This is her second loan with MFP and she feels that this loan will help her grow as a farmer. She is a very active and supportive member of her community bank. She plans to buy coffee and cacao seeds with the twenty five hundred Nuevos Soles she has requested which will help assure her next harvest.

loans.use: Purchase cacao and coffee seeds

loans.name: Olga Elisa

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal “Luz Andina” ubicado en el distrito de Cabanilla, provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene 02 hijos, la señora tiene estudios de educación superior completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años,  nos cuenta que su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de abarrotes, papa y combustibles.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de mercadería de su tienda, papa y combustible.

Su sueño es tener una librería o ferretería en la plaza.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la colaboración que ve en el grupo.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the community bank "Luz Andina" (Light of the Andes), which is located in the Cabanilla district in the province of Lampa and the department of Puno. She is 29 years old, is married, has two children, and has completed higher studies.

She began to work with Movimiento Manuela Ramos three years ago. She tells us that her first loan was for 500 PEN, and the money allowed her to increase the working capital for her business, which is selling groceries, potatoes, and fuel.

Now she is applying for a new loan of 500 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her store, potatoes, and fuel. 

Her dream is to have a bookstore or hardware store on the plaza.

What she likes most about her community bank are the punctuality and collaboration that she sees in the group.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business, a grocery store

loans.name: Floriana

texts.es: Floriana, de 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Filomeno de 43 años y su querido hijo Marco de 4 añitos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado cultivar Floriana, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao, café y hoja de coca, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve grandes y abundantes, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es llevar lo cosechado hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, que es el lugar donde los vende, ya que los sacos en donde lleva los productos son muy pesados. En  adelante, espera mejorar sus productos para así poder obtener mejores precios. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuota puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas, con lo cual espera asegurar sus futuras cosechas.
texts.en:
Floriana is 40 years old and is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house with her 43-year-old husband, Filomeno, and 4-year-old son, Marco, who are the reason for all of her efforts.

The crops that Floriana has been able to grow with a lot of effort and dedication have helped her a great deal in progressing in life. Every morning she begins to work on her lands because she knows that the care that she provides to her cacao, coffee, and coca leaf plants will determine the quality of the crops that she obtains. What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops and she feels very happy when she sees them large and plentiful. She has been in this type of work for three years and she considers the most difficult part to be bringing her crops to the city of San Francisco (located in the department of Ayacucho) where she sells them, because the sacks which she uses to bring the crops are very heavy. In the future, she hopes to improve her crops so that she can sell them at a better price.

This is Floriana’s third loan with MFP and she knows that she has to make her loan payments on time and is prepared to do so. She is a very supportive and responsible member of her communal bank. With the 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will buy seeds, which she hopes will ensure her future harvests.

loans.use: To buy cacao and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana T., tiene 30 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones,oficios domésticos, trabaja en la microempresa, en la producción y confección de ropa, dicho trabajo lo ha estado realizando desde hace mas de 3 años,con dicho trabajo a logrado sostener a sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera, quiere aumentar su capital de trabajo, por lo que se acerca a las instalaciones de ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para compra de mas materia prima, quiere un negocio grande por esos hace esta inversión, solo asi podrá dar un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en: Juana T. is 30 years old, single, and has two sons.  She works at a small business making clothing and has been in this line of work for more than three years.  With her job, she has been able to support her two children, as she is a single mother.  She wants to increase her working capital, which is why she went to the ASDIR offices to request a loan for the purchase of more raw materials.  She wants to have a large business which is why she is making this investment because it is the only way that she will be able to provide her family with a better future.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Pastora es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 45 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, con un hijo y con grado D. instrucción D. primaria completa.
Pastora trabaja con artesanía, elaborando todo tipo D. tejidos en miniatura, además del engorD. D. ganado. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace cuatro años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Ahora  solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir la alegría.
texts.en:
Pastora is a member of the “Ciudad Nueva” community bank.  She is 45 years old and married with one child.  She completed her primary education.

Pastora is a craftswoman.  She makes all kinds of small knitted items.  She also fattens cattle.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and it enabled her to increase her business capital.

She is now requesting a new loan for 2,000 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to continue moving forward with her business.  What she likes about her community bank is sharing happiness.

loans.use: To increase the working capital of her craft business

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy, de 35 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y luchador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Marlene de 24 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Muy temprano por la mañana, Fredy sale a trabajar sus tierras que se encuentran a una hora de caminata, él tiene sembrado cacao, café y hoja de coca, cultivos que cuida con mucho cariño y esfuerzo, ya que sabe que de la buena cosecha que tenga, dependerá el sustento económico con el que cuente su familia. Paralelamente a esta actividad su esposa, tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la cual también ayuda en generar ingresos para su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos, es por eso que nunca se olvida de fumigar sus tierras. En el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras donde pueda sembrar. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagar sus cuotas por falta de dinero, así que ya esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas, es de los pocos varones de su banco comunal motivo por el cual siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias. Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en la compra de semillas de cacao y café para aumentar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Fredy, thirty-five, is very unassuming and a real fighter.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Marlene, twenty-four, and their three beloved children, to whom he wants to bring a better quality of life.  He goes out very early in the morning to work his fields, which are an hour's walk.  He has planted cacao, coffee, and cocoa leaves, with which he takes great care and effort since he knows that his family's financial support depends on how good the harvest is.  In addition, his wife has a grocery store, which helps bring in income for the family.  

What Fredy likes best about his work is planting his fields, which he does with great care.  He works twelve months a year and considers the hardest part to be protecting his crops from any pests that might affect them; he never forgets to spray his fields.  In the future he would like to purchase additional fields to plant.  

This will be Fredy's second loan with MFP. He doesn't want to fail to make payments for lack of money, so he is already saving up.  He's one of the few men at his village bank, so he always tries to be responsible and respectful toward the other members.  He will invest the two thousand soles he is seeking in the purchase of cacao and coffee seeds to increase production.

loans.use: To buy cacao and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Pelagia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 51 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, con ocho hijos y con grado D. instrucción D. primaria  incompleta.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace siete años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo invirtió en la compra D. redes para la pesca, actividad que realiza su esposo. Actualmente ella realiza la venta D. pescado en las diferentes ferias D.  la zona. 
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio. 
Su sueño  es crecer en su negocio. Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la unión.
texts.en:
Pelagia is a member of the communal bank "San Salvador," located in the Capachica district in the province and department of Puno.  She is 51 years old, married, and has 8 children.  She completed only part of her primary education.

Pelagia has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 7 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she invested in the purchase of fishing nets, as her husband is a fisherman.  Now she sells the fish in different markets in the area.

She is currently requesting a loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, which will allow her to increase the working capital in her business.

Her dream is to grow her business.  What she enjoys about the communal bank is the solidarity of the members, who are punctual with their payments.

loans.use: to increase the working capital of her business

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor Manuel, ofrece sus servicios de taxi todos los días de la semana de 5:00am á 9:00pm, tiene 39 años de edad, reside con su esposa en la Ciudad de San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, no tiene hijos actualmente.
Este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre ya que se dedico a este oficio por muchos años y para él fue una fuente de ingreso que le llamo la atención es por eso que hoy día se dedica a prestar este servicio, su riesgo en este trabajo es la delincuencia; sus clientes mayormente los representan amigos y conocidos de la zona.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para darle mantenimiento al vehículo (taxi), con este préstamo él quiere tener en las mejores condiciones el taxi para garantizar a sus clientes un viaje seguro y tranquilo. Su objetivo es seguir trabajando para recibir ingresos que ayuden a su familia a mantener una buena condición económica.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel offers his taxi services every day of the week from 5.00am to 9.00pm.  He is 39 years old and lives with his wife in the city of San Miguel, in the department of San Miguel.  They don't currently have any children.

He learned this work from his father who did the job for many years and for him it was a source of income which drew his attention.  This is why he now provides this service.  His risk in this business is crime; his customers are mainly friends and acquaintances from the area.

He is requesting this loan so that he can have maintenance work done on his taxi.  He would like to use this loan to improve the condition of his taxi so that he can guarantee his customers a safe and peaceful ride.  His goal is to continue working to make an income which will help his family to maintain good economic conditions.

loans.use: To improve his vehicle (taxi)

loans.name: Moises Alberto

texts.es:
Don Moisés, un señor de 50 años de edad, dedicado a la venta de minutas de varios sabores, el reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, él vive solo.
Él ya tiene 6 años de dedicarse al negocio de las minutas lo hace de forma ambulante por las principales calles de Jiquilisco, solicita un préstamo para la compra de los materiales para preparar las minutas ya que en este momento se ha quedado sin dinero para impulsar el negocio. Con este préstamo el podrá realizar sus ventas duna manera normal, ya que su inversión seria en Hielo, vasos descartables, miel de frutas y leche. 
Don Moisés quiere tener en los próximos meses un aumento en sus ventas para poder ahorrar y reparar su carretón de minutas,  también quiere con el préstamo ser buen cliente y realizar sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
Moisés is 50 years old.  He sells 'minutas' (slushy frozen drinks) in different flavors.  He lives on his own in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.

Moisés has been in the 'minutas' business for 6 years.  He sells his drinks around the main streets of Jiquilisco.  He is requesting a loan to buy materials to prepare his drinks since at the moment he doesn't have enough money to move the business forward.  With this loan he will be able to carry out his sales normally since the investment will be in ice, disposable cups, fruit syrup and milk.

Moisés would like to see a rise in his sales over the next few months so that he can save and repair his sales cart.  He also wants to be a good client and make his repayments punctually.

loans.use: To buy ice, cups and syrup

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 40 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y humilde, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Flora de 39 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Las tierras de Jorge, son de las mejores cultivadas en el poblado de Palmapampa (pueblo ubicado en la selva Ayacuchana) él tiene sembrado cacao, café y hoja de coca, productos que son rápidamente comprados por los mayoristas en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que saben de la buena calidad de sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad, motivo por el cual es considerado uno de los mejores agricultores de su pueblo, siente que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que afectan a sus plantaciones. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono y fertilizantes para volver más productiva sus tierras.
texts.en: Jorge is 40 years old.  He is a very hard-working and humble man.  He lives in his own house with his wife Flora, who is 39 years old, and their 4 beloved children for whom they want to create a better future.  Jorge's land is amongst the best cultivated in the village of Palmapampa (which is located in the Ayacuchana jungle).  He grows cacao, coffee and coca leaf, products which are quickly bought by wholesalers in the city of San Francisco since they know that his crops are of good quality.  What he most likes about his work is cultivating his land and he does this with a lot of care.  He has been in the business for 15 years which is why he is considered one of the best farmers in his village.  He feels that the most difficult part of his work is caring for his crops and protecting them from infestations of insects which can damage his plantations.  Over time he hopes to buy new land to increase his crop production.  This is his second loan from MFP and he feels capable of making his repayments.  He is one of the most active members of his community bank and, for this reason, he is very well liked and respected.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles that he is requesting, he will buy fertilizers to make his land more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Josefa Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Josefa, tiene 59 años de edad, esta casada, de oficios domesticos, actualmente tiene un tienda de consumo diario, con el fin de surtir su tienda solicita un prestamos para invertir en este negocio, y asi brindar un mejor servicio, y con ello también tenga un mejor ingreso de ganancia, los cual es muy importante para ella mantener este negocio con olon necesario, por eso se ha acercado a ASDIR para solicitar un prestamo que le servirá como inversión en dicho negocio.
texts.en: Doña Josefa is 59 years old and married.  In addition to being responsible for domestic duties, she currently runs a store that sells goods for daily use.  She is requesting a loan from ASDIR to invest in stocking her store.  This way she can offer better service and also increase her income.  For this reason it is very important for her to stock the necessities.

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es:
Jhony, es un comerciante de CD Y DVD, es casado y reside con su esposa, su madre y hermanos en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, aun no tiene hijos. Este negocio de venta de Cd y DVD es la fuente de ingreso que él tiene, de acá logra compra todas sus cosas y ver por las necesidades del hogar. 
Él quiere mejorar el negocio y para esto quiere invertir solicitando un préstamo por un monto que considera será suficiente para realizar la inversión, al mismo tiempo quiere una parte de préstamo tomarla para reparar su vehículo ya que está presentando algunos problemas mecánicos porque él quiere que antes que el problema se le complique poder en este momento solucionarlo, llevando al mecánico para que este la repare.
Su objetivo es tener bien establecido el negocio, que sus ventas aumenten, tener en buenas condiciones su vehículo y velar cada día por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Jhony is a CD and DVD merchant. He is married and lives with his wife, his mother, and his siblings in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután. He does not yet have children. His business of selling CDs and DVDs is his source of income and it is what allows him to buy things and provide the household necessities.
 
He wants to improve his business and in order to do that he is requesting a loan for an amount that he considers sufficient to make the needed investment. He would also like to use a portion of the loan to repair his car because it has some mechanical problems; before it gets worse, he wants to take it to a mechanic to repair it. 

His goals are to get his business well established, to increase sales, to have his car in good working condition, and to look after his family’s well-being every day.

loans.use: To buy CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 41 años, es un hombre muy sincero y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Demetrio de 41 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, Juan sale a trabajar a su chacra, sabe que tiene que poner todo su esfuerzo en hacer más fértil sus tierras, para poder obtener una buena cosecha. Sus productos, como la hoja de coca, el café y el cacao, los vende en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde tiene muchos compradores, debido a la buena calidad de sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que siempre corre el peligro de que los químicos le causen alguna enfermedad. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar sus cultivos. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, en su primer pago fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, es de los pocos varones de su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy querido por el resto de las socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus chacras estén muy productivas, para la temporada de siembra que se acerca.
texts.en:
Juan is 41 years old and is a very honest, hard-working man.  He lives in his own house with his wife Demetrio, 41, and their two beloved children who are the motivating force behind all his efforts.  

Every day, very early in the morning, Juan leaves to go to work on his farm.  He knows that he has to put a lot of effort into making his land fertile in order to have a good harvest.  He grows coca leaves, coffee and cocoa that he sells in the city of San Francisco where he has many buyers because of the quality of his crops.   He has been doing this for 21 years now and what he likes best about his job is planting his fields and this he does with a great deal of patience.  He considers fumigating his fields the most difficult part of his job because he worries about the dangers of the toxic chemicals.  In time, he wants to buy more land to increase his production.  

This is his second loan with MFP.  With his first loan he was very punctual with his payments and hopes to do the same this time.  He is one of the few men in his communal bank which is respected by the rest of the female members.  With the two thousand nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that he is requesting, he will buy manure and fertilizer for his land because he wants his farm to be very productive in the upcoming season.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to increase his production of coca leaves, coffee and cocoa

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
Rina es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y con 03 hijos. La señora tiene estudios de educación primaria completa.

Rina viene trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos  desde hace 03 años, su    préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de comidas y gaseosas.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar mercaderías para su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital y mejorar el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Rina is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” community bank which is located in Azángaro district, in Azángaro province, in the department of Puno.  She is 36 years old, married and has 3 children.  She completed her primary education.

Rina has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years.  Her initial loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to increase the capital for her business selling food and sodas.

She is now requesting a new loan for 300 nuevos soles to buy goods for her business.

Her dream for the future is to have more capital and to improve her business.

What she most likes about her community bank is the ease with which she can obtain loans.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: La señora Imelda A. A., tiene la edad de 53 años es madre soltera habitante del Barrio Laureles Norte, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan y sobreviven bajo sus propios esfuerzos, ella se dedica a cuidar a una señora de edad desde hace 3 años, tiempo atrás laboraba como domestica, pero a raíz del padecimiento de la dueña de la casa comenzó a ayudarle en su enfermedad. Ella habita en una humilde casa y es para su hogar que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de un cuarto en el patio de su hogar,  con la compra de materiales de cosntruccion, para la edificacion de una pared que la proteja, es para ella una necesidad el terminar de edificar su hogar, puesto que habita en un espacio bastante humilde con limitaciones que afectan su diario vivir, y el de su familia.
texts.en: Mrs Imelda A. A. is 53 years old.  She is a single mother and lives in Laureles Norte neighborhood.  She has 4 grown-up children who work and support themselves.  She has been working looking after an elderly lady for 3 years.  She used to work as a domestic but as a result of the suffering of the lady of the house, she began to help her in her illness.  She lives in a humble house and it is for her house that she is requesting this loan.  She would like to buy building materials to improve the infrastructure of a room in the open space outside her house by building a wall which will protect her.  It is necessary for her to finish building her house since she lives in quite a humble space with limitations which affect her daily life and that of her family.

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Lia

texts.es: Lía, de 22 años, es una joven muy sencilla y alegre, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro, para ello esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Recorriendo las calles de la ciudad de San Francisco, Lía realiza su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y es una vendedora muy convincente, motivo por el cual sus productos se venden muy rápido y tiene que renovarlos constantemente. Siente que su trabajo es muy rentable, ya que gracias a él, puede ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que mejor actuaran sobre su piel, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus productos de belleza. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y está muy feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que invertirá todo este aporte en su negocio, ya que quiere mejorar su trabajo y su calidad de vida. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos de belleza, para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de donde elegir.
texts.en:
Lía is 22 years old.  She is a very humble and happy young woman.  She live in her parents' house and what she would like more than anything is to create a good future for herself.  For this, she is prepared to work very hard.  Lía carries out her work selling cosmetics round the streets of the city of San Francisco.  She is a very convincing saleswoman which means that her products sell very quickly and she constantly has to replace them.  She feels that her work is very profitable and, thanks to this, she can help her family with their household expenses.  What she most likes about her work is advising her customers about which products will best work with their skin.  She has been doing this work for 2 years and she considers that the most difficult about it is having to walk all day looking for customers.  Over time, she would like to have a store where she can sell her beauty products more comfortably.

This is her second loan from MFP and she is very happy to get it.  She says that she will invest it all in her business since she would like to improve her work and her quality of life.  She is a very cheerful member of her community bank.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles she is requesting, she will buy more beauty products so that she can offer her customers a better range of products to choose from.

loans.use: To stock up with more cosmetics

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas D. Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y con 5 hijos. Tiene grado D. instrucción primaria incompleta.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace siete meses, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo utilizo para invertir en su negocio D. compra y venta D. animales menores. 
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 700.00 nuevo soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio y poder comprar un toro y así continuar con el engorD. D. ganados.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante con su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es trabajar en grupo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Brisas del Río Blanco” (White River Breezes) Communal Bank, located in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, department of Puno.  She is 53 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She did not finish primary school.
This lady has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for seven months.  The first loan requested was 500 new soles, which she used to invest in her business (buying and selling small animals).
She is now requesting another loan, for 700 new soles, which will allow her to increase her working capital and buy a bull, to continue to fatten her cattle.
Her dream is to continue to maintain her business.  What she likes about the communal bank is working with a group.

loans.use: To increase her working capital by buying a bull.

loans.name: Yutachi Group

texts.es:
El grupo "YUTACHI",se ubica en el poblado de S. Jamiltepec Oaxaca, Mexico,. El nombre de este grupo esta enlengua mixteca, que significa "El arroyo(rio) de los abuelos,yuta es igual a rio y chi quiere decir abuelo, decidieron ponerle este nombre a su grupo ya que el lugar llanado yutachi que es el pozo de agua; se encuentra cerca del  punto de reunion del grupo, y tambien en honor a sus ancestros.Son 11 personas las que integran al grupo, junto con su representante que sellama, Anastacia N. M..
En esta ocacion hablaremos de la señora Esther Leonor Baños J. , ella integra este grupo, tiene 46 años cumplidos, es casada y su esposo se llama Lorenzo de 50 de edad, quien se dedica al oficio de la talabarteria y el campo, actualmente llevan 22 años de casados procrearon  a 4 hijos, dentro de los cuales tres estan con vida y uno ya fallecio de nombre Josefina(+)quien era la tercera hija de esta familia, y murio por complicaciones de salud y atencion medica especializada,producto de la pobreza y desigualdad de la sociedad, actualmente existen Alejandro de 21 años, Felipe de 19 y Joel de 11 años de edad y que cursa la educacion secundaria. Doña Esther curso solamente la educacion primaria.
Esther utilizo el prestamo que le otorgaron para la adquisicion de material que utiliza para la elaboracion de sus bordados artesanales que son bolsas de mano, carteras,blusas,servilletas y manteles que los elabora utilizando un numero de puntadas diferentes como son, el punto de cruz,trenza margarita, pata de gallo, rococo, estrella,de cadena y el la complicada tecnica del deshilado en punto de cruz y el bordado de blusas con piedras de chaquiras. Entre la gran lista de materiales utilizados para este hermoso trabajo destacan los siguientes; tela lino panama,manta, tergal,manta hilada a mano,hiulos varios como es el hilo de algodon, estambre para bordado, hilo iris vela y de algodon el colores distintos, descocedor, piedras de chaquiras, aros para boradar y agujas en distintos tamaños. Ella inicio desde hace mas de cuatro años debido a la necesidad propia de superacion economica.
Su mas grande sueño de esther es integrar un gran numero de personas que vivan en condiciones extremas de pobreza, para enseñarles todo lo que ella sabe si distincion alguna de sexo ni credo, esto on el fin de promopver el autoempleo para las mas bulnerables que son las mujeres y la clase indigena, otra de sus metas es que otras personas conoscan sus artesanias, promoverlas  e impulsaralas para tener mas ingresos economicos y desta manera hacer crecer su proyecto, asi como el apoyo para la educacion de sus hijos.
Esther actualmente se ha dedicado de pllenop a la capacitacion de mas personas para el tarbajo por medio de una dependencia social llamada ICAPET asi como el programa gubernamental poara los indigenas llamada CDI,esto es muestra de que a pesar de la gran desigualdad social todavia existen personas que sueñan, que estan haciendo algo y que su gran compromiso es el amor hacia los demas.
Ella nos dice habla con estas apalbras," le agradesco afundacion realidad por confiar en los pobres, por ayudar aliberarnos de esas cadenas que nos atan llamada pobreza, y por confiar en un sector abandonado y que nadien nos voltea a ver, gracias por todo y DIOS les bendiga siempre.
las que integran el grupo son las siguientes personas y sus actividades:
SALUSTIA T. M.-   TIENDA DE ABARROTES
VICTORINA G. M.-     VENTA DE ROPA
GAUDENCIA M. H.- COCINA ECONOMICA
JOVITA N. P.-        VENTA DE QUESOS
DIVINA ALBINA M. S.-ELABORACION DE PAN
ADELA M. R.-            VENTA DE PRFUMES 
ROSALIA V. M.-       ELABORACION DE PAN
ANASTACIA N. M.-   TIENDA DE ABARROTES
ESTHER LEONOR B. J.-   ELABORACION DE ARTESANIAS
YURELI A. M.-            VENTA DE PAN
MARIA ELENA G. M.-    VENTA DE ROPA
texts.en:
The “YUTACHI” group is located in S. Jamiltepec Oaxaca, Mexico.  The group's name is in the Mixtecan language and means “The stream (river) of the grandparents”.  'YUTA' means 'stream (river)' and 'CHI' means 'grandparent'.  They decided to give the group this name since the town of Yutachi is near the group's meeting point, and also to honor of their ancestors.  There are 11 people in the group, together with their representative who is called Anastacia N. M..

On this occasion we will talk about Mrs Esther Leonor Baños J. who is a member of this group.  She is 46 years old and married.  Her husband is called Lorenzo and he is 50 years old.  He works as a belt maker and as an agricultural worker.  They have been married for 22 years and have had 4 children.  Three of their children are still alive.  Josefina(+), who was their third child, died from health complications and lack of specialized medical care.  This was a result of the poverty and inequality of society.  Their remaining children are Alejandro, 21; Felipe, 19 and Joel who is 11 and is pursuing his secondary education.  Esther only studied at elementary level.

Esther used the loan which they were awarded to acquire material to use for making her hand-made embroideries.  She makes handbags, wallets, blouses, napkins and tablecloths using a number of different stitches such as cross-stitch, 'trenza margarita', 'pato de gallo', rococo, star, chain, the complicated technique of openwork in cross stitch and the embroidery of blouses with seedglass beads.  Among the long list of materials which she uses for this beautiful work are the following: Panama linen, cotton skirting, tergal (a synthetic fibre containing polyester),  hand-spun cotton, different threads such as cotton thread, worsted for embroideries and 'iris vela' thread, all in different colors, stitch unpickers, seedglass beads, embroidery hoops and different sized needles.  She started her business more than four years ago owing to her own need for financial improvement.

Esther's biggest dream is to gather together a large number of people who live in conditions of extreme poverty, to teach them everything that she knows without distinction of sex or creed.  She would like to promote self employment for the most vulnerable who are women and indigenous people.  Another of her goals is for other people to find out about her crafts and promote them so that she can make more profits and, in this way, help her project grow as well as provide support for her children's education.

Esther is currently working hard on training more people to work through a social office called ICAPET as well as the governmental program for indigenous people called CDI.  This shows that despite the great inequality of society, there are still people who dream, who are doing something and that their great commitment is their love towards other people.

She tells us to speak with these words, “I am grateful to Fundación Realidad for trusting in the poor, for helping to free us from these chains which bind us called poverty and for believing in an abandoned sector of society who nobody turns to see.  Thank you for everything and God bless you forever”.

The following is a list of the members of this group and their business activities:

Salustia T. M. – Grocery store
Victorina G. M. – Clothes sales
Gaudencia M. H. – Affordable meals
Jovita N. P. – Cheese sales
Divina Albina M. S. – Bread making
Adela M. R. – Perfume sales
Rosalia V. M. – Bread making
Anastacia N. M. – Grocery store
Esther Leonor Baños  J. – Making handicrafts
Yureli A. M. – Bread sales
Maria Elena G. M. – Clothes sales

loans.use: To buy materials for making handicrafts such as; Panama linen, cotton skirting, tergal, seralon thread, cotton, seedglass beads, skein of Vela thread, silk thread, unpickers, embroidery hoops and fasteners

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “22 de Setiembre” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con seis hijos y sin estudios.
Rosa   se dedica  a la crianza, compra y venta de animales menores, además de esto, también realiza el engorde de ganados como, toros y chanchos. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, con un préstamo inicial de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, el cual  le permitió iniciar con la actividad que realiza. Agradece a la institución por haberle dado la facilidad del préstamo para poder levantarse y seguir adelante no solo  en lo económico sino también en lo moral a través de las charlas.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio.
Su sueño es seguir adelante  con  su negocio y tener una granja de cuyes. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank "22 de Septiembre" [September 22nd] located in the Llave district, province of El Collao and department of Puno. She is 50 years of age, in a committed relationship, with six children and uneducated. 

Rosa earns a living raising, buying and selling small animals. In addition to this she fattens livestock such as bulls and pigs. She has been working with the Manuela Rosa Movement for five years with an initial loan of 300 nuevos soles which allowed her to start up her business. She appreciates the institution for granting her the loan so that she may rise up and continue on, not just economically but also morally by means of the talks. 

Now she will seek a new loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, money which will allow her to expand her business capital. Her dream is to continue on in her business and have a guinea pig farm. Her favorite part of the Communal Bank are the talks.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” ubicado en el distrito Cabanilla,  provincia D. Lampa, departamento D. Puno, tiene 76 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda y tiene 10 hijos (02 dependientes). La señora solo tiene estudios D. educación primaria.

Rosa viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años, su  préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. venta D. comida D. la Región.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá comprando ganados para luego venderlos.

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio. Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women), which is located in the District of Cabanilla, Lampa Province, Department of Puno. She is 76 years old, widowed, and has ten children (two of whom are dependents). Sra. Rosa has an elementary school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for the past two years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and used to increase her business capital for selling regional foods.

Rosa is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 2000 PEN to invest in the purchase of cattle that she will sell later. Her dream is to improve her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings and the punctuality.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito de Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y no tiene hijos, realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

Ella viene trabajando con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 meses, su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para  incrementar el capital de su negocio venta de quesos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá comprando productos para la elaboración de quesos.

Su sueño es tener una pollería. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the Communal Bank “Azangarinas Valientes”, which is located in the District and Province of Azángaro, Department of Puno. She is 21 years old and in a common law marriage, but does not have children. Roxana completed her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for four months. Her first loan was in the amount of 500 PEN and used to increase her business capital for selling cheese.

Sra. Roxana is requesting a new loan in the amount of 800 PEN to invest in products used for making cheese. Her dream is to open a poultry shop. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making cheese

loans.name: Seferina Apolinar

texts.es:
Seferina es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol” ubicado en el distrito de Paucarcolla, provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, estado civil viuda, con seis hijos y con grado de instrucción de segundo de primaria.
Seferina tiene diferentes actividades como,  venta de abarrotes, gaseosas, y comercio ambulatorio como la venta de quesos y leche. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, con el cual lo pudo utilizar en su ultima actividad ya mencionada.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1900.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar la mercadería de su negocio.
Su sueño es  tener capital propio y tener  un restaurant. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  son los ahorros que generan las ganancias.
texts.en:
Seferina is a member of the “Apostle Santiago” Community Bank in Paucarcolla district, in the province and department of Puno. She is 55 years old, widowed, and has seven children. She completed grade 2 of primary school.

Seferina works at various jobs including selling groceries and soft drinks, and she also sells cheese and milk in the street. She has worked with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past four years. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to start the cheese and milk business.

Now she is seeking another loan, this time for 1900 soles, which she will use to buy more stock for her store. Seferina’s dream is to have enough capital to open a restaurant. She most likes the opportunity to save and earn interest with her Community Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Mr. Pech H. is a villager in Kandal village in Kandal province and he is 56-years-old. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family and his wife.  Mrs. Yorng Choeung, is a pig breeder and white wine maker. His problem is that his wife’s pigs are too small to sell, but he did not have enough money to support them. So to improve the breeding, Mr. Pech H. is applying for a loan to buy more pig food. He is a father of five children, one of whom is a car repairer, another is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other one is a farmer, and the others are attending a local school. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy more pig food.

loans.name: Khem's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. They live in Preaek Touch village in Kandal province. Mrs. Khem P., who was born in 1947, is the group leader who was selected by the other members. She is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in the garment factory. 

She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice, but not to sell to support her family. Now is the time to grow rice, but she does not have enough rice seed to plant. So, to improve production, Mrs. Khem P. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed, and with the rest of the loan, she is going to hire a farm laborer and oxen to plow her field.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Hak's Group

texts.en:
Four members living in Peam Reang Kraom village in Kandal province make up this group loan. Their portion of the loan can improve their standard of living. Mrs. Hak P. is 44 years old and was selected by the other members as the group leader. 

She and her husband, Mr. Vanna Sor, are farmers who own a five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Now she has some problems because her field has infertile soil. So, to improve rice production, Mrs. Hak P. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is a farmer, another is selling groceries in the local village, and the last is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya lives in a 2-room brick house in a small city called Depalpur. Her husband’s name is M. Y. and he has a computer repair shop in the market.

Suraiya is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. She has given birth to 4 sons. None of them are enrolled in school because Suraiya and her husband can’t afford their education expenses.

Suraiya’s husband is the only breadwinner in the family so it is very necessary for him to establish his business to improve her family's financial condition.  Therefore, Suraiya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will utilize the loan in purchasing the latest repairing tools and computer accessories for his shop.

She is confident that her husband, who has been doing this business for past 10 years, will successfully be able to achieve positive results from his business after investing the loan money into it.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy the latest repairing tools and accessories for computer repair shop

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
The young woman in the photograph is Mrs. Phat T., age 27, who lives in the province of Siem Reap, which is the best territory for tourists.  Mrs. Phat T. is a married woman who is devoted to her two young children, one of whom is enrolled in school and the other one is depending on her care.

Mrs. Phat T. and her husband are rattan cupboard sellers and they have been operating their business for a few years in front of their house. This couple also orders rattan items in bulk from braiders and then takes it to retail in their community and other provinces.  Mrs. Phat T. is now running her business very well because she sells her items at a reasonable price.

In order to better satisfy the needs of the customers, Mrs. Phat T. seeks a loan to buy a larger amount of rattan cupboards to sell. She proposes to use the remainder of loan to purchase a trailer for the transportation of her product.

loans.use: To buy a larger amount of rattan cupboards to sell.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Depalpur, which is a small city in Pakistan. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area named Abdullah Basti for the last 20 years. 

She is a 43 year old lady married to 47 year old S. M., who runs a service station. He offers car and motorbike washing services to his clients and also sells motor oils.

Perveen is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. She is also a very good mother who is bringing up her children with great care. She has given birth to 2 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son helps his father in his business. He is 18 years of age and left his education after completing 10th standard grade. Her other children stay at home and don't go to school.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy car oil and washing items to provide better services to his clients. 

Her husband has been doing this business for the past 10 years and Perveen is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and make him more money.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy car oil and washing items for service station

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has been farming for eight years. Her mixed farm produces milk, vegetables and eggs which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from her kiosk which she operates in the same region. Her major challenges in farming have been lack of enough animal feed and the high cost of pesticides.

Beatrice is 32 years old and is a single mother of 3 school-aged children who all attend school.

Beatrice has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo after she successfully completed her third loan of 70,000 KES. She has requested this loan of 71,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow and expand her poultry farm. She says that with this loan, her family will be guaranteed enough milk and eggs for domestic consumption and sale.

She says that in the next 5 years she plans to acquire 4 dairy cows and a posho mill (a grinding machine that crushes maize into maize flour) to increase her productivity and income.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and expand her poultry farm.

loans.name: Jovelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jovelyn I. is from the village of Dammang West, Echague, Isabela. She is 29 years old. Jovelyn is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jovelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra has been practicing mixed farming for seven years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His farm produces milk and eggs which he sells to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the needs of his family. He faces the challenges of diseases which affects his production and lack of storage facilities for his animal feeds.

Ezra is 56 years old. He is married with 4 school-aged children who all attend school.

He recently repaid his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 70,000KES and has requested this loan of 71,200KES to purchase a dairy cow and expand his poultry farm. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him provide for the basic needs of his family. In future, he would like to acquire 5 dairy cows and a posho mill to increase his productivity.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow and expand his poultry farm.

loans.name: Ashra's Group

texts.en:
Ashra is the mother of 2 sons. Her elder son has a business of selling animals while her younger son is 16 years old and has left school after 5th  grade. He stays at home and doesn’t work. She is married to M. A. who also involved in animal sales business. He buys animals like goats, buffalo from the animal markets at cheap rates, raises and sells them to butchers and other customers earning a good profit. 

Ashra lives with her family in a 2 room brick house in the area named Abdullah basti which is a small housing community in Depalpur. Depalpur is a small city of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living here since her marriage.  Ashra is a housewife, stays at home and does her household works but in her spare time she also helps her husband in his business by taking care of the cattle. She gives them timely food and water. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. He will invest the loan in purchasing animals to improve his sales.  He has been doing this business for over 15 years and Ashra is hopeful that this investment will be more profitable for her husband and hopes his income will double.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ashra.

loans.use: To buy animals for an animal sales business

loans.name: Ruttoh

texts.en:
Ruttoh has a mixed farm in Litein, a town in the Rift Valley, Kenya, that produces maize and milk. He has been practicing mixed farming for two years. He sells his products at the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm for his needs. He is 21 years old and single.

Ruttoh has requested this loan of 50,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle to transport his milk to the market. He says that this motorcycle will enable him to be more efficient and this will increase his income. His primary challenge has been lack of enough capital to expand his farming activities. In the future, he would like to expand his dairy business by purchasing more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport milk to the market.

loans.name: Oyunerdene

texts.en: Oyunerdene, a 53-year-old mother of 2 children, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live in a small wooden house. Her husband, Sambuudorj, 55, works in a “Housing Service LLC” as a machinist, and her daughter is a student at Humanities University.  She operates a grocery store in her yard and has been operating her business for over 3 years. Her store has an excellent location, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local residents. In the future, she is planning to purchase large amounts of products for her store to increase her sales. With this loan, she will purchase furniture for her son who currently lives separately.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her son who lives separately.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is the resident of Depalpur which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its dairy industry. She lives in the area named Basti abdullah with her family in a 2 room house.  She is a housewife, stays at home and does her household responsibilities. Her children are very young and needs her full time attention. She is the mother of 3 years old daughter and 2 sons, the elder one is 2 years old and younger one is just 1 year old. 

Khalida is 38 years old and married to N. A. who is involved in a transportation business for over 10 years. He operates a donkey cart, providing load and transport services to his customers and generates income for the family. His cart has become worn and needs a replacement otherwise, his work will be stopped, which he can’t afford as his earning are the main financial source of his family.  

Therefore, Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new donkey cart for her husband. She is hopeful that with the new cart her husband will be able to continue his work and provide better services to his clients.  

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.  

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for a transport business

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Twenty-eight years old Hillary is a married father of one child who is 4 months old. He is a dairy farmer from Litein town in the Rift Valley, Kenya. He sells his milk to the local hotels in Litein town. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea which he sells to a local tea factory. His biggest challenge has been the poor road network to the market.

He has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for transporting milk to the market. The income from this loan will enable him meet the needs of his family. In future, he would like to expand his dairy farming and purchase a lorry for transporting milk to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a  motorcycle for transporting milk to the market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new machine for his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy necessary materials for her business

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for ten years and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to a cooling plant in Litein town. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea which he sells to a local tea factory, and a garage which he operates in the same region. His biggest challenges in farming have been the poor road network and lack of enough funds to expand his farm.

He has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for transporting milk to the cooling plant. He says that this motorcycle will enable him to transport his milk to the plant without any problem. It will also be used as an asset to secure more loans in the future. Someday, he would like to purchase a pick-up truck to help transport milk to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transporting milk to the market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a shop and expand his business.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is widowed. She owns a retail business selling various agricultural products like seeds, fertilizers, bug killers, etc. Tatyana has a large assortment of products, affordable prices and a good reputation at the market. She has many repeat clients who buy items from her to use on their gardens.

Tatyana has been in this business for 17 years. The business is seasonal, with items selling mostly in spring and summer. In this particular area, many people grow a lot of vegetables, so Tatyana's goods are in demand. She hopes to develop her business further and have more clients who would use her services. Tatyana is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to purchase seasonal inventories - seeds and fertilizers – that her clients will start buying soon. Tatyana hopes to receive additional income and improve her business conditions by fixing the store where she works.

Note: the picture shows Tatyana with her worker.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess A. is from the village of Brgy. Comon, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old. Maritess is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maritess owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport in the local community. Maritess has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maritess joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maritess has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Maritess is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Maritess from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family members. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima H. lives in the Kasenke 2 neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of four grandchildren.    

H. has a charcoal business.  She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works six days out of every week. She sells her products from home at retail prices.    

She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal. She also generates additional income through her rentals and piped water. The main business challenges for H. include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to get her own delivery van and start wholesale selling only.  

H. lives in a home that she owns and where she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees for her grandchildren and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N., a married mother of two children, both students, lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. For the past eight years, working six days a week, Harriet has operated a business selling second-hand shoes at the market. She also generates additional income through roasting sweet potatoes and maize in the evening. Harriet is requesting a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second hand shoes.

Harriet's main business challenge is seasonality. Her business goal is to start importing second-hand shoes. Harriet lives in a home that she rents with access to neither electricity nor piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food for the family

This is a new business for her. In addition to this business, she continues to make and sell food such as chicken and pork adobo. Alona has been engaged in this business for more than nine years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Alona is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Alona from HSPFI. Tatyana would like to purchase seasonal clothing for sale. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 grivnas. Tatyana built a new booth last year. This gives her a competitive advantage in attracting more clients and increasing sales.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca N. lives In Kamwokya Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has eight children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members ( in-laws ).  Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.   

Rebecca has a business of selling fruit and vegetables. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and she works every day. Rebecca sells her products from home. She also generates additional income through her rental rooms. The main business challenges for Rebecca include competition and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing these fruits herself.

Rebecca has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of oranges, tomatoes, onions and cabbages to sell.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of oranges, onions, tomatoes and cabbages

Joyce learned about KADET Ltd. through marketing awareness work being done in the area, and so she is applying for her first loan of KES 20000 from KADET Ltd., with which she intends to buy different sizes of polythene bags. The anticipated profits will be used to expand the polythene shop business.

Her deeper desire is to see her children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.name: John Lekakeny

texts.en:
John N. is 40 years old from the Osupuko area in Kilgoris. He is married to Lillian and they have three children: 18 year old Cale, 15 year old Ruth and 2 year old Memusi.

John is a farmer and he plants maize and vegetables on his farm. He is currently in need of maize and green vegetable seeds to add to his stock. He also needs money to pay for labour charges during harvest time.  He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is also a client of KADET. His farm is in Osupuko village near Osupuko dispensary in Kilgoris and here the demand for maize is very high.

His desire is to produce more maize that can maximize profits that will enable him take better care of his family's needs and be able to pay school fees without struggling.

loans.name: Chuluunbat

texts.en:
Chuluunbat M. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest daughter is a university student in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia, and his youngest daughter attends a local secondary school. 

Chuluunbat is a carpenter and produces a variety of home furnishings according to his customers' orders. He started his wood products production business in 1998 after working as a carpenter in a local company for 10 years. His wife, Ulziijargal, manages a consumer goods and clothing items trade business in their town. His wife has been engaged this business since 2002, selling a variety of consumer goods and clothes in the local market. 

Their business is located in the popular spot of the market which attracts many customers. Chuluunbat says, "I work hard to improve and expand our businesses till my two daughters grow up and become good people with high educational background who can support us back." 

He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes and consumer goods to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and consumer goods

In 2008, Ignacio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ignacio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Ignacio is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be Ignacio's 5th loan from ASKI.
